mega-man.name: Mega Man
mega-man.description2: Before the world of Robot Masters, before the world of mechanical conflict, Dr. Light and Dr. Wily were partners, pioneering the world of robotic technologies together. After a failed prototype, a single robot was created, who would serve to be the template for all robots afterward. This robot was named Rock, and was later followed by his sister Roll and the Robot Masters, a team of industrial humanoid robots designed to help humanity. However, Dr. Light’s lab partner, Dr. Wily, was jealous of Light’s critical acclaim and stole the Robot Masters, harming humanity instead of protecting it. When all hope seemed lost, Rock, with a strong sense of justice, volunteered to stop the rampaging robots himself and was upgraded to become Mega Man! With the Variable Weapons System, Mega Buster, and the hope of the world on his shoulders, he prevailed against Dr. Wily’s malicious plans. However, Dr. Wily continued his work to make new plans and robots, even stealing other's work to benefit himself! However, each time has resulted in failure due to Mega Man’s fight for justice. Mega Man hasn’t done everything himself though. Drs. Light and Cossack have made various upgrades, including a slide, an explosive ball, and a charging blast ability, while also working on various other robots designed to help Mega Man’s struggle, most notably his robodog Rush. He also gains support from mysterious allies, and from the various robotic denizens of the world. As long as Mega Man is in the fight, hope will never be lost!

quotes.battle_start: Stand down, {target_robot}! I don't want to fight you!
quotes.battle_taunt: If you won't stand down, then... I'll have to stop you!
quotes.battle_victory: Rock on! We make a great team, don't we, {this_player}?
quotes.battle_defeat: I can't let you beat me! I have to get stronger...

bass.name: Bass
bass.description2: Dr. Wily, having experienced failure upon failure upon even more failure, concluded that perhaps his Robot Masters were too focused on one singular aspect, hence their piddling results against his nemesis. After going through Mega Man's schematics, he eventually decided to make a robot just as adaptable as Mega Man, the end result being Bass, the most recurring rival of the Blue Bomber. Bass is equipped with the rapid-fire Bass Buster, an accelerating dash, and the Variable Weapons System, just like Mega Man. He also generously uses the Super Adaptor technology he "borrowed" from Dr. Light, which allows him to fuse with Treble, his support mecha. Although Bass is a diamond in the roughs of Wily's forces, commanding him is nigh impossible! He’s reckless and acts entirely on his own accord, leading him to go against Dr. Wily a multitude of times! Although one might suppose Bass is evil incarnate, he's aided many attempts to maintain world peace, stopping a robot revolution and a robot-influenza, illustrating that perhaps Bass isn't as cruel as he lets on. Even the galactic scale of justice robot, Duo, could feel a glimmer of it in Bass, even if that sense of justice is motivated entirely by self-interest. Like the tails to Mega Man's heads, they both strongly fight for what they believe in.... These beliefs just happen to conflict pretty often.

quotes.battle_start: Shut up, {target_robot}! Get out of my way or be destroyed!
quotes.battle_taunt: Who can worry about justice or chaos... when power is all that matters!
quotes.battle_victory: Ha ha ha! Behold the power of the world's strongest robot!
quotes.battle_defeat: ... Curse you! I can... I can still fight!

proto-man.name: Proto Man
proto-man.description2: Once the origin point for every bit of mechanical life today, Proto Man's now taken the mantle of being a renegade that stops villainy in the shadows. Proto Man has the Proto Buster, his trusty Proto Shield, the Variable Weapons System, and his trump card that redirects power directly from his nuclear core, the Proto Strike. Unfortunately, that outdated core is also Proto Man's greatest flaw; it's completely destabilized and acts as a ticker to his own life, for once that core breaks down, so will Proto Man. Proto Man's a resilient robot who seems to take pride in his lone wolf status, and despite his disconnection to the Light family, retains a sense of brotherhood with Mega Man as he assists the Blue Bomber. Proto Man's overall history is admittedly tragic and arduous, as he fled from his father figure, Dr. Light, to avoid repairs to his core and thus hang on to his identity. He roamed the world with only solitude and an impending end as his companions, eventually being manipulated by Dr. Wily to work under the guise of "Break Man" to properly spite Dr. Light once and for all. However, once it became apparent what Dr. Wily's true ambition was, he quickly turned on the doctor and saved Mega Man's life, forever cementing that he was neither Dr. Light's mistake nor Dr. Wily's weapon, instead finding his identity as his own independent robot, the Red Renegade Proto Man! Since then, he's worked to preserve world peace, and due to rescuing Kalinka and a sense of respect for Dr. Cossack, has recently found himself welcomed into the Cossack home. Despite showing some age, Proto Man's a great fighter among robots—-and he's a good whistler, too!

quotes.battle_start: I've stood by for long enough; this ends now.
quotes.battle_taunt: I'm no hero, {target_robot}. Expect no mercy coming from me.
quotes.battle_victory: If you want to blame something, blame your own fate... As I do.
quotes.battle_defeat: Breaking apart in this Prototype... I suppose it's only poetic...

roll.name: Roll
roll.description2: Although crafted by Dr. Light to have a hand maintaining the Light household, Roll's breaking gender roles by intending to assist in battle after being stuck in the sidelines for as long as she has! A pedestrian glance might find Roll too dainty to come as help, but she's got great gymnastic skill and can use common household items such as brooms and umbrellas to surprisingly devastatingly effects! However, Roll's main strength, befitting her supportive nature, specializes in techniques that benefit her friends and detriments her foes. Roll's often the most efficient and serene of the Light family, with a bit of an innocent schoolgirl tinge to her, but what's most notable is her persevering and admirable "Go-get-'em!" attitude. She's supportive and helpful in every sense she can be, and a friend to people, robots, animals, and mechas everywhere. Ever since she was infected by Dr. Wily's Roboenza virus, she felt responsible for worrying Mega Man and weakening his sense of focus, since then putting her efforts into having more of a presence outside of being the Light family's housekeeper. As such, she's intent on garnering the weight of everyone's hopes along with Mega Man, standing as courageously as her brother does on the battlefield! Not many know it, not even the other members of the Light family, but this was her dream all along....

quotes.battle_start: I've got my role to play just like everyone else! I've gotta do my best!
quotes.battle_taunt: Hey, don't go easy on me just because my brother's Mega Man!
quotes.battle_victory: We did it, {this_player}! Thank you for believing in me!
quotes.battle_defeat: I can't lose here... everyone's depending on me!

disco.name: Disco
disco.description2: With his frustrations throughout the years, Dr. Wily could only ponder what it was about Dr. Light that allowed him to prevail each and every time: he created a parallel for both Mega Man and Rush in the form of Bass and Treble, yet they only served to be a thorn in his side. With each conclusion, Dr. Wily's mind was brought back to one scene; an infected Roll sacrificing her medicine for the sake of preserving Mega Man's well-being. He quickly realized he needed a robot who had that exact same sense of loyalty towards him, a parallel to Roll who can stand behind him for his world domination conquest-- A right-hand man...no, woman! Disco is an apprentice robot built by Dr. Wily to be his perfect analogue to Roll, for the sake of providing obedience and loyalty in ways that Bass never could. Opposite to the way Roll specializes in boost and support abilities, Disco specializes in break and assault abilities, lowering her targets' stats to dangerously low levels in short time and setting them up for a prompt defeat. Much like her brother robot's feelings toward Mega Man, Disco has a deeply rooted rivalry with Roll and will use any opportunity to flaunt her battle prowess in Roll's presence. It doesn't appear to bother her logic that she owes her entire conception to Roll, but believed superiority over their righteous counterparts seems to be a running theme with the Wily family, doesn't it?

quotes.battle_start: Battle? Please, I bet you fight about as well as you look.
quotes.battle_taunt: You're getting weaker... And here I thought that wasn't possible.
quotes.battle_victory: Did you really think you stood a chance?
quotes.battle_defeat: I'm a creation of the great Lord Wily.... how could I lose?!

rhythm.name: Rhythm
rhythm.description2: Rhythm is a digital support robot coded by Dr. Cossack and integrated directly into the data of the Prototype. Rhythm's initial function was to act as a kind of debug tool for the two doctors during the prototype's development, tweaking values and swapping parameters as needed, but recent events have forced Cossack to use her data to take on a direct combat role instead. As a genius hacker, Rhythm excels in abilities that modify the system from the inside to alter the conditions of battle in strange and unusual ways. Rhythm's a child prodigy, keeping a somewhat whimsical and carefree attitude interspersed with a love for complex equations and a massive intellect to match. Due to a lack of social interaction beforehand, Rhythm lacks a proper relationship with both Proto Man or any of the other Cossack numbers. Despite this, she continues to support them regardless for the sake of Dr. Cossack's well-being. She does secretly envy Roll and Disco though, as they get to wear the pretty casual clothes while she's stuck with a boring old combat uniform! With abilities that allow her to swap robot stats at will, Rhythm's a complete game-breaker for the world of Prototype; of course, only a child would lack the fairness to not cheat their way towards winning a game!

quotes.battle_start: With you as my operator, {this_player}... no parameters will stop us!
quotes.battle_taunt: I've run the numbers, and we win every time!
quotes.battle_victory: Yay, I did it! My calculations were right on!
quotes.battle_defeat: This variable wasn't accounted for at all... don't tell me it's a bug!

cut-man.name: Cut Man
cut-man.description2: Cut Man was designed to be a lumber-felling robot, his tool of trade being his over-sized, goofy cutters, which in case you haven't noticed, sit firmly on the top of his head. However, those cutters happen to be his weapon of trade too, his signature technique being the "Rolling Cutter" where he throws his cutters at decently fast speeds! Cut Man also later developed the "Rising Cutter", an attack in which he releases a hilariously oversized pair of scissors to rise from the ground and sever enemies in twain. You'd expect someone working with such hazards to be pretty responsible, a honorable figure who takes every situation with a degree of maturity, but that certainly doesn't describe Cut Man. He's really just an overgrown child with a tendency to make horrible, horrible, horrible puns, puns most people wish he'd really just cut it out with. They thankfully don't always have to listen; Cut Man's a robot with a busy schedule, as requests for his help are sent from all over the world. And what exactly could one expect? Cut Man's function boils down to "cut stuff", so from hedge-trimming to hair-cutting to chopping lumber, he's got a lot of areas to cover.
cut-man.skill_description: Boosts the robot's attack upon disabling a target
cut-man.skill_description2: The robot's mettle automatically boosts their attack stat any time they successfully inflict a knockout in battle.

quotes.battle_start: May the sharpest mind win!
quotes.battle_taunt: I ain't your ordinary Robot Master... I'm a cut above the rest!
quotes.battle_victory: What can I say? Ol' {this_robot}'s still cutting-edge, HAH!
quotes.battle_defeat: W-well, I guess I wasn't sharp enough!... heheh, not funny?

guts-man.name: Guts Man
guts-man.description2: Guts Man was built for civil engineering, and for the sake of that duty, he's been gifted tremendous strength. With the Super Arm modification he has, he can pick up a huge object many times heavier than himself and throw it like it was absolutely nothing. Give him something practically weightless in comparison to his strength, like maybe your average robot, and he can chuck it through a football field! Guts Man may be hot-tempered and stubborn, maybe overly stubborn, but deep inside it may be a surprise to hear he's a real softy. In fact, he loves Karaoke and tends to visit the local Karaoke bar almost every day after work, and it's been said his singing is almost indescribable, a sound no words could ever give justice to. But all of that happens after work; Guts Man never takes a break until his shift completely wraps up. At the end of the day however, he does really mean well, and despite his rough exterior and his muscles of steel, the guy's got a heart of gold.
guts-man.skill_description: Protects the robot's defense stat from being reduced
guts-man.skill_description2: The robot's defense stat can only be raised and any attempts to reduce it will have no effect.

quotes.battle_start: Hey, {target_robot}! A wimp like you doesn't belong on a foreman's turf!
quotes.battle_taunt: There you go, kid! Now you're starting to show some real guts!
quotes.battle_victory: My shift's about over, {this_player}... So let's start Karaoke Hour!
quotes.battle_defeat: Good stuff, kid.. winning a fight ain't always about doing what's in the blueprints!

ice-man.name: Ice Man
ice-man.description2: Created to function under cold climate conditions, Ice Man's the most comfortable playing out in the snow. His Ice Slasher is a sharp piece of ice he form to freeze opponents, so cool it can stop a fiery opponent right in their tracks. His Ice Breath is also pretty impressive, releasing cold pieces of frost to immobilize his opponents. Ice Man's a pretty huge show-off, believing that he's the coolest robot out there, and the admiration from Freeze Man doesn’t really hurt his ego. Ice Man loves having snow fights and he absolutely loves the winter season, but he hates getting remotely near a sauna, due to feeling stuffy in them. Although one might suppose Ice Man can’t function well in hot environments, he performs averagely well in them, he simply just wouldn't want to be caught dead in them. He also has a bit of a crush on the acclaimed TV journalist Plum, but don't tell anyone! Ice Man's willingness to demonstrate how cool he is may just come from an inflated ego, but any of the fighters who might've tumbled with him could support that belief. Granted, they likely don't mean cool in the same way, but he'll take any chance he can get to show off.
ice-man.skill_description: Increases the Freeze-type field multiplier on battle start
ice-man.skill_description2: The robot increases the Freeze-type field multiplier upon entering battle in order to gather as much attention as possible.

quotes.battle_start: Don't mess with me, {target_robot}! Unless you wanna end up an ice statue!
quotes.battle_taunt: Uhh... what exactly's a good soldier supposed to do here again?
quotes.battle_victory: Hey, {this_player}! Everyone! Did you see how I won?
quotes.battle_defeat: Sniff.. I'm...I'm not gonna go home and cry... yet!

bomb-man.name: Bomb Man
bomb-man.description2: Dr. Light felt like Guts Man had a particularly dangerous job, so he went ahead and created Bomb Man to work in conjunction with him. His Hyper Bomb is an explosive with a special material that allows it to blow up much larger than a regular explosive, but the Hyper Bomb suffers from this in the aspect of its weight limiting how far it could be thrown. Bomb Man circumvents this however, by bouncing through the air and simply dropping his bombs, catching his opponents below off-guard with a devastating aerial attack. He also has the much larger Danger Bomb, but the risk with this technique stays true to its namesake; it's pretty dangerous. He loves going to firework events and showcases, being infatuated with the beautiful combustion that resemble his own work. Bomb Man's an avid bowling player too, playing and rolling the ball with exceptional ease. One time, after forgetting to bring his bowling ball, he quickly improvised and used his own bombs as a makeshift ball, sparking the now-popular sport, Bomb Bowling. This obsession with bombs isn't exactly the safest hobby one can have, but Bomb Man happens to find the most fun in the things that aren't always the most safe for him.
bomb-man.skill_description: The robot disables hazardous explosives at the end of the turn
bomb-man.skill_description2: The robot employs expert knowledge of munitions to disarm any nearby explosives at the end of each turn.

quotes.battle_start: Yo, {target_robot}! Let's have a little fun with my explosives!
quotes.battle_taunt: Watch it! Bombs aren't toys, y'know!
quotes.battle_victory: C'mon dude, the party ain't over yet!.... uhh, dude?
quotes.battle_defeat: No way! You're supposed to blow up, not me!

fire-man.name: Fire Man
fire-man.description2: Due to foreseeable issues with rising waste production, Dr. Light wanted to deal with it in the most creative way he could. So, he went ahead and made Fire Man in order to burn it all until there was nothing left. Fire Man's Fire Storm ability can easily reach temperatures to over 7000 degrees, allowing him to focus in a stream of fire while using its excess energy to protect himself. He's even been able to hone in his fire production even further, creating the Fire Chaser technique. Fire Man's sense of justice is the most fiery thing about him though, strongly believing in what he calls the "Flames of Justice" and primarily why he created the Fire Chaser technique in the first place. Fire Man had a brief stint as a vigilante of the night, trying to round up villainy and stop it in its tracks, but this was short-lived as his flame would quickly give out where he was hiding in the middle of the night. In his off-time, he enjoys camping and relaxing in the summer, but gets rather down on rainy days. Fire Man was the first of a multitude of flame-based robots, but he hasn't been proved outdated yet; perhaps it's his strong belief in the Flames of Justice that keep him pressing forward.
fire-man.skill_description: The robot can inflict Flame type damage without resistance
fire-man.skill_description2: The robot ignores resistances and negative multipliers when dealing Flame-type damage to targets.

quotes.battle_start: I reckon you cool yourself down, pardner, or I'll fire you!
quotes.battle_taunt: Evildoers beware! My righteous flame can't ever be extinguished!
quotes.battle_victory: Evil! Remember my name, for I am {this_robot}!
quotes.battle_defeat: My light ain't strong enough alone... to burn through this freezing injustice!

elec-man.name: Elec Man
elec-man.description2: When Elec Man first stepped foot into this world, he was easily the most powerful robot ever created, and considered by most as Dr. Light's greatest traditional Robot Master. While his slender appearance may not seem like it suggested anything particularly robust, it was his control of electricity that shocked and amazed scientists throughout the globe. Elec Man was put to work in controlling any and all flow in surrounding electrical plants, but nothing compares to the output of his Thunder Beam, a spurt of electrical energy that can pierce through rock. It's a lot of energy to pull off though, so unless the circumstance is dire, Elec Man tends to stick with the less-demanding Thunder Strike ability. Elec Man boasts a razor-sharp judgement and leadership skills, a responsible robot for any Mecha to look up to, but when not leading, Elec Man oftentimes tends to be pretty self-concerned and thinks a little too highly of himself. He was also one of the first robots to give Mega Man a run for his money, his electrical strikes being able to easily pierce Mega Man's meager defenses. Elec Man's electrical control is absolutely astounding and still researched today, and despite the increasing plethora of electrical robots, Elec Man's still as impressive today as he was when he was when first created.

quotes.battle_start: The enlightening look of lightning in the air-- It's set to start!
quotes.battle_taunt: Someone of your low voltage could never hope to stop me!
quotes.battle_victory: My electric communication, it's a power that tears through sheer imagination!
quotes.battle_defeat: This pulse... It appears your heart cannot be shocked!

time-man.name: Time Man
time-man.description2: Time Man was created for research on the growing research field of time, but unforeseen time restraints stopped production on Time Man. The main problem was his confusing algorithm system that Dr. Light thought would make him too “powered up” compared to other robots, so he thought he would temporarily shelve the project. Sometime not far after, Dr. Wily stole him and completed him, although not without some flaws and compromises. Time Man was originally supposed to be able to stop time completely for a few short seconds, but now he can only slow down time for a few seconds, something his successor was able to manage. To make up for this, Dr. Wily gave him the Time Arrow in order to make him more offensively viable. Time Man's all about being punctual, going so far that he even plans his day out the week before! He's awfully conceited however, and he doesn't tend to speak if he finds that a response would only waste his time. Time Man has found use as the top researcher at the Chronos Time-Space Institute and was instrumental in the creation of the "Time Skipper", but after Wily haphazardly used it, the research for it was utterly wasted. Time Man does annoy others with his schedule, but it appears that it does give him an awful lot of free time....The thing is though, he finds hobbies to be a waste of time, so if you don't have hobbies to enjoy your free time with, what's the point of being so punctual?

quotes.battle_start: Finally. I grew tired of waiting.
quotes.battle_taunt: You're ahead of schedule... let me slow you down!
quotes.battle_victory: 0.03 seconds late... Just sloppy.
quotes.battle_defeat: Time waits for no one....

oil-man.name: Oil Man
oil-man.description2: Oil Man was made to solve the impending energy crisis that Dr. Light feared would occur with the new robotic way of the future, but eventually, Light decided to use solar energy and decided to hold off on Oil Man's creation. The main developmental issue was his confusing algorithm system that Dr. Light thought would make him too “powered up” compared to other robots, so he thought he’d hold off on the project. Some time not far after, Dr. Wily stole him and completed him, although not without some flaws and compromises. It was too late for Dr. Wily to convert his energy source to solar nor did he really care, so Wily just figured Oil Man could stick with the oil energy source and he could just power himself. Oil Man utilizes the Oil Shooter, a buster attachment that allows him to create oil quickly to splat nearby enemies. This goes great with the Oil Slider on which he slides at high speeds to damage enemies head-on. Oil Man works at an oil refinery, where he pays constant attention to the oil production. He was never really obligated to work there, but Oil Man simply loves being a part of the process. He's got a very loose personality and prefers to do things at the last minute, much to the dismay of Time Man who he often accompanies himself with. Oil Man also has business connections with Flame Man, seeing as Flame Man's one of the few other robots who willingly power themselves with oil. He doesn't tend to get close to him however; he's well aware of what happens when oil and fire happen to cross paths.
oil-man.skill_description: Protects the robot's speed stat from being reduced
oil-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat cannot be lowered and any attempts to reduce it will have no effect.

quotes.battle_start: I dig your style, {target_robot} - but I see you ain't here for a fill-up, yeah?
quotes.battle_taunt: I'm gonna kick your butt so hard, you'll be smelling the oil from my boots for months!
quotes.battle_victory: Pretty slick, {target_robot}.. but ain't nobody as slick as me, baby.
quotes.battle_defeat: Hey.. whadja have to go and do that for?

metal-man.name: Metal Man
metal-man.description2: Dr. Wily's first full-fledged attempt on individually making his own Robot Master, Metal Man owes his design from the schematics of Cut Man. However, their similarities end there; Metal Man's Metal Blades are much more deadly than anything Cut Man's made, being razor-sharp discs that can be thrown for pinpoint accuracy. He's fond of using the environment to his advantage in order to overwhelm his opponents, switching between conveyor belt to conveyor belt before unleashing a barrage of Metal Blades. Metal Man's an efficient and determined worker, but fellow coworkers often have issues working with him due to his dry wit and untrustworthy tone. On his free time, he enjoys playing with flying discs in the park, for reasons that certainly shouldn't need any explanation. Although he may not display his emotions about it, Metal Man also gets incredibly flustered whenever someone mockingly calls him a dentist. Metal Man's an incredibly fierce opponent with a killer weapon, but it appears that his own armor isn't all that durable. Chances are it probably couldn't even endure his own Metal Blades!
metal-man.skill_description: The robot's attack is boosted when around other Cutter cores
metal-man.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is boosted two stages for each additional Cutter-core robot on the field.

quotes.battle_start: Don't expect some formal intro; I'm only here to tear you in two!
quotes.battle_taunt: Here, try and catch this next attack! Ghee hee hee...
quotes.battle_victory: That's unsatisfying, but expected; no one can withstand my Metal Blades!
quotes.battle_defeat: No... I shouldn't be the one who's torn up!

air-man.name: Air Man
air-man.description2: Created by Dr. Wily to serve as a combat robot, Air Man was given an unusual yet intimidating look; instead of spending resources on developing an individual head, Dr. Wily simply put Air Man's face right on his torso! Air Man employs the wind to attack and push aside his enemies, generating powerful gusts and tornadoes with the propeller installed on his body. He can also pump wind through his body directly to his buster, allowing him to create a barrage of condensed wind he refers to as the Air Shooter. Despite having a fan for a mouth, Air Man can speak perfectly clear, and in fact speaks too much. He's often been referred to as condescending and had bored even the most stalwart of robots with his speeches. Most of the time, he grandiosely talks about his own feats and his fortitude as a fighter, claiming he believes there will never be a robot who could ever beat him. When he's not blowing hot air, Air Man enjoys wind surfing and playing the Japanese card game, Menko. Regardless of all his big talk, Air Man's winds are no laughing matter. They can completely blow away your expectations--and you as well!
air-man.skill_description: The robot blows away opposing core shields at the start of each turn
air-man.skill_description2: The robot blows away opposing core shields at the start of each turn and additionally delays their regeneration.

quotes.battle_start: {target_robot}? What wind blows you here?
quotes.battle_taunt: Is that all you can manage? Now I'll blow you away!
quotes.battle_victory: Poor {target_robot}.... You should've known you can't beat me.
quotes.battle_defeat: Ahw.. Ahw, mya propelleh brokuh! Noooou!

bubble-man.name: Bubble Man
bubble-man.description2: Bubble Man was the first Robot Master made for aquatic combat, completely able to glide naturally across the seas with ease. On land, it's a different story; he can basically only bounce around and make Dr. Wily erupt in laughter. Still, Bubble Man's gracefulness in water isn't any laughing matter, especially when he's using his Bubble Lead ability. While it may appear to be a harmless bubble, looks aren't everything; that bubble is actually made of pure lead and can completely wear away a robot's armor in a matter of seconds. He can also attack with a Bubble Spray, which is notable for being particularly conductive. Despite being the butt of about every joke in the robot community, Bubble Man's a affable individual who's interested in proving himself to the entire world. He's bad with budgets however, once spending away a large portion of Dr. Wily's Zenny for the sake of having the world's biggest bubble blower collection. Dr. Wily was not pleased. It's best to not make fun of him directly in front of his face, as while he may be a nice guy, his Bubble Lead's sent plenty of robots straight down to Davy Jones's locker.
bubble-man.skill_description: Boosts the robot's speed on Water-type fields
bubble-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat is boosted by three stages at the start of the battle if the Water-type field multiplier is high.

quotes.battle_start: Welcome to Davy Jones's Locker, {target_robot}! Allow me to be your guide!
quotes.battle_taunt: Stop making me look bad already! Fear my mighty bubbles! Fear them!
quotes.battle_victory: Haha! See that, {this_player}? I'm your strongest robot!
quotes.battle_defeat: Welp, I'm sure the bubbles will work next time, {this_robot}....

quick-man.name: Quick Man
quick-man.description2: Designed for high-speed combat, Quick Man is easily one of the fastest man-made robots, outpacing just about anything with enough sentience to challenge him. Comprised of light-weight materials, he's able to rapidly dash around and attack his opponent with nothing but his sheer velocity and his signature weapon, the Quick Boomerang. Quick Man's a confident and cunning robot, and while it may seem like he's always got a looming strategy up his sleeve, in actuality every action he makes is improvised and based all on effective quick thinking. At the same time, he's impulsive and impatient, and is willing to drop whatever he's doing to prove his worth in a race. Notably, when Quick Man was competing in the Battle and Chase competition, he forfeited his lead simply because he got bored and would've rather spent his time racing against Turbo Man, a fellow Robot Master rival of his. Quick Man's speed is absolutely phenomenal, and despite being one of Dr. Wily's first attempts of individually making a robot, Quick Man still serves to be one of the fastest robots in Wily's arsenal. However, because of his lightweight composition, his other capabilities suffer as a result. Still, it's hard to hit what you can't keep up with.
quick-man.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's speed when in danger
quick-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat is boosted by three stages when they're pushed to the brink in battle.

quotes.battle_start: Let's see if you can keep up with my speed!
quotes.battle_taunt: Geez, a robot like you couldn't even keep up with the ground!
quotes.battle_victory: It's a shame you couldn't even get to see me completely humiliate you, {target_robot}!
quotes.battle_defeat: This is embarrassing... I mean, seriously, I'm Quick Man!

crash-man.name: Crash Man
crash-man.description2: Designed to crash and clash, Crash Man was created by Dr. Wily in an effort to combine both Guts Man and Bomb Man's best attributes into one agile robot. While at first glance he may appear rather clumsy, Crash Man's adept at causing large-scale damage with all sorts of explosives, his favorite being his very own Crash Bomber. To be quite frank, Crash Man's likely to destroy stuff even if he isn't asked to. That being said, he's an obedient robot who's willing to help out Dr. Wily whenever needed .... If he's in a good mood, that is. While a majority of the time Crash Man can be docile, he can easily be thrown into a trigger-happy rage where he can end up causing thousands in property damage. Because of this, Dr. Wily tends to keep Crash Man on a short leash within a controllable environment. With his temper and his Crash Bomber, however, Crash Man is an invaluable asset on the battlefield, if only because chances are there'll be nothing left on it once he's finished. Now if only he could figure out how to pick things up with his hands....

quotes.battle_start: Hahaha! I'm gonna blast everyone into smithereens!
quotes.battle_taunt: I'll destroy everything with these hands of destruction!... or, uh, drills.
quotes.battle_victory: I'm pure destruction, plain and simple! The world's, like, papier-mâché to me!
quotes.battle_defeat: Can't a guy just destroy everything in peace...?

flash-man.name: Flash Man
flash-man.description2: Continuing off from his research where Time Man ended, Dr. Wily purposed Flash Man for combat with the gimmick of being able to completely stop time whenever needed. This short burst of temporal energy is referred to as the Flash Stopper, where Flash Man can mercilessly attack his adversaries while giving the appearance of phasing in and out of reality. Because he has to direct so much energy into his Flash Stopper though, his regular offensive capabilities are frankly unimpressive. Flash Man's been described with many saccharine adjectives such as "contemptible" and "inconsiderate", scoffing aside the considerations of others. Deep down though, Flash Man's actually quite nice and benevolent, a leader who cares deeply for the conditions of his subordinates. His aspirations are to be on the stage one day, an actor who loves having the spotlight on him whenever he performs. So far, he's only been given roles as an extra in films or plays --he did get an opportunity to star as a pitchman for a wig brand, but for whatever reason he turned the offer down in a furious rage. When he's bored, Flash Man loves using his time-stopping powers for his own devious motives, whether it be to play pranks on his fellow robots or to extend the amount of time he spends at his leisure. While it appears he's more interested on being on the stage rather than the battlefield, Flash Man's abilities are no act; it's the type of stuff Time Man wishes he could do.
flash-man.skill_description: The robot nullifies speed stat changes at the end of each turn
flash-man.skill_description2: The robot maintains the normal flow of time by nullifying any speed stat changes at the end of each turn.

quotes.battle_start: No robot can stand against time! It ends here, {target_robot}!
quotes.battle_taunt: It's not that I don't have any hair, it's just... thinning a bit!
quotes.battle_victory: Heh heh, I'll freeze this moment to feel victorious forever!
quotes.battle_defeat: I've strut and fret my hour upon the stage...

heat-man.name: Heat Man
heat-man.description2: Based off of Fire Man's capabilities yet inspired by Ice Man's design, Heat Man is another of Dr. Wily's combat robots. Combining both fierce flames with a fortified defensive armor, Heat Man's Atomic Fire is a flame that grows progressively stronger in succession, allowing Heat Man to take attacks head-on while dealing devastating damage. His armor's not without its flaws though, as oftentimes his lid will unintentionally close down on his own head. He's also able to enshroud himself in flames, where he can then launch himself to crash right into his targets. While Heat Man's a care-free individual and can carry out work at his own pace, he has difficulty dealing with deadlines. This leads to him quickly becoming unenthusiastic and nonchalant about his work, causing accidents that still do nothing to jolt his excitement for his occupation. Heat Man is known for his barbecuing expertise as well as being deathly afraid of ice cream, which is .... certainly a peculiar fear! With his intensive heat exceeding even that of Fire Man's, Heat Man's quite the improvement over his original counterpart. At least, mostly. His work just doesn't have the same heart and soul put into it, you know?
heat-man.skill_description: The robot recovers lost health by resting at the end of a turn
heat-man.skill_description2: The robot recovers lost health by taking siestas at the end of any turn it can but loses speed in the process.

quotes.battle_start: Boy... it sure is hot around here.
quotes.battle_taunt: Watch out, I guess?
quotes.battle_victory: I won? Oh... that's great. Yep. Super-excited.
quotes.battle_defeat: I think I'll probably call in sick tomorrow...

wood-man.name: Wood Man
wood-man.description2: Designed around the idea of camouflaged combat, and also to care for Dr. Wily's personal garden, Wood Man's body was made out of durable hinoki cypress, coated with a thin layer of metal to help preserve and enforce that cypress. Unfortunately, while the cypress is incredibly fortified and practically unbreakable, it's not exempt from natural deterioration nor damage from excessive heat, coupled with the fact that the cypress isn't really lightweight. To help try to circumvent that, Dr. Wily gave Wood Man the Leaf Shield, and while leaves don't really seem like they'd be a practical defensive item, Wood Man's actually using dulled pieces of leaf-shaped Ceratanium to protect himself. He's a nature fanatic, often heading out on hiking and mountaineering trips, and even serving as a park guide from time to time despite his criminal record as one of Dr. Wily's robots. Naturally, since he's so fond of nature's beauty, Wood Man's also fond of breaking the backs of anyone so daring to disrespect it, easily offended at the sight of the nearest litterer. Despite this, Wood Man is usually quite kind to both his colleagues and to the animal Mechas of Wily's forces, and holds environmental meetings along with Wave Man for the Wily robots to attend. He's a kind naturalist and a fortified warrior, and although skeptics may be stumped by his hinoki design, it helps to keep him closer to the beautiful world he loves..... It's lame, but it's sincerely lame!
wood-man.skill_description: The robot heals wounded allies from the bench at the end of each turn
wood-man.skill_description2: The robot uses its natural healing abilities from the bench to restore health to wounded allies after each turn.

quotes.battle_start: I am the shield of Mother Nature-- I will not back down!
quotes.battle_taunt: I speak for the trees, for the trees have no tongue!
quotes.battle_victory: Unless someone like me cares enough, things won't get better!
quotes.battle_defeat: Won't somebody please think of the trees?

needle-man.name: Needle Man
needle-man.description2: Designed in conjunction by both Drs. Light and Wily to be able to pierce bedrock for mining, Needle Man was based on Air Man's build and sacrifices traditional hands for the sake of his rapid-firing Needle Cannon. His jumping prowess is quite impressive and can provide enough force to keep him suspended in the air, which is where he can surprise opponents with his quick barrage of needles. That's not all he has in his pointy repertoire though, as he can toss the needles on his head for short-range combat, a somewhat straightforward tactic but it's his way of continuing to surprise his opponents. Needle Man's somewhat of a well-read individual and an intellectual, but this is coupled with his dry wit and his sarcastic tone of speaking, making him a difficult robot to get a read on. His hobbies include knitting and sewing, and he's always quick to make people known of the distinction between the two, but ironically enough Needle Man's deathly afraid of injections, shots, and just about anything medical that goes hand-in-hand with needles. Of course, Needle Man's a robot in the first place, so as far as fears go, his are as irrational as they come. Granted, it's not his concerns that matter in battle, it's his opponents; when he's unleashing a barrage of piercing needles, any opponents or clumsy teammates should be wary of becoming a veritable robot shish kebab.
needle-man.skill_description: Protects the robot's attack stat from being reduced
needle-man.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat can only be raised and any attempts to reduce it will have no effect.

quotes.battle_start: Bring it, {target_robot}! I'll make this place your grave!
quotes.battle_taunt: Grrr... I'll make you into a pincushion!
quotes.battle_victory: Awww, could 'widdle {target_robot} not handle my flawless work?
quotes.battle_defeat: Ohhh, by all means, you did so great.. No, uhuh, seriously, I mean it.

magnet-man.name: Magnet Man
magnet-man.description2: A co-designed robot from the minds of Dr. Light and Dr. Wily, Magnet Man was designed from the start to be a master of magnetism. Of course, as with anything with Wily's name on it, he was promptly utilized in matters most nefarious. He can specifically launch the aptly-named "Magnet Missiles" to close and home in on any robot, guaranteeing utmost precision with the usage of ferromagnetic wavelengths! And, to further cement his distance-controlling tactics and strategies, Magnet Man's also capable of acting as a functioning magnetic generator, drawing in attracted adversaries to annihilate them in a brief barrage of close-combat firing. All in all, Magnet Man is an avant-garde aficionado when it comes to the turmoils of war, the utter epitome of a forward-thinking tactician and a remarkable leader. Yet, he is rather abrasive and without a commander like Dr. Wily to order him on, he does lack a sense of direction. Also, even though he's a robot, Magnet Man's been suffering from stiffness in his joints lately, so he's been scheduling weekly appointments with a proper chiropractor, specifically dealing in magnetic therapy and massages! Moving beyond Magnet Man's medical history, he's a phenomenal tactician with an admirable sense of seriousness!... But, it is awfully hard to take him seriously with the goofy magnet on his head, isn't it?

quotes.battle_start: I'm gonna push you around, then pull you back again!
quotes.battle_taunt: Are you drawn to my magnetic personality?
quotes.battle_victory: Admit it, you're attracted to me!
quotes.battle_defeat: I have been feeling tense these days...

gemini-man.name: Gemini Man
gemini-man.description2: Being able to clone yourself can be considered a spectacular battle feat, but creating the illusion of being able to do so is even more effective. That's Gemini Man's modus operandi, a robot co-designed by both Drs. Light and Wily to ward off any potential smugglers from their energy mining efforts. As subtly aforementioned, Gemini Man has the special capability of forming holographic imitations of himself to confuse and overwhelm his opposition, but that's not his sole gimmick; he's capable of also spouting off the Gemini Laser, a high-piercing beam of light that refracts off surfaces to specifically overwhelm opponents through surprise. He's a tricky man of mystery, but not without his fair share of personality quirks. His most notable issue is his overwhelming narcissism; really, a narcissism that goes beyond the regular definition and into a borderline obsession. An appropriate obsession though, seeing the whole nature of his replication technique and everything. Still, not an entirely healthy obsession... Anyway, moving on, Gemini Man's still a robot willing to put everything on the line for his comrades and brethren, making him an incredibly reliable robot on the field. But, for those who find themselves battling against Gemini Man: might be worth double-checking that you're fighting the real guy, yeah?

quotes.battle_start: Which one of us is the real one?
quotes.battle_taunt: Beat us? We'd like to see you try!
quotes.battle_victory: My clones were pretty impressive, don't you think?
quotes.battle_defeat: T-there was a snake! It distracted us! No, really!

hard-man.name: Hard Man
hard-man.description2: For context, a special few Robot Masters have an advantage in the form of a super incredibly durable metal coined "Ceratanium"; Cut Man's signature cutter, the shielding of Wood Man, and Metal Man's piercing blades. Now that you're aware of this, that should make Hard Man all the more imposing when it's revealed his body is almost entirely composed out of the stuff! With his Ceratanium composition, his body is nigh invincible and impervious to damage, and to say nothing about how he hits with that armor! While that does form an inherent flaw in his mobility, Dr. Wily managed to cleverly circumvent his range issue with the Hard Knuckle weapon, where Hard Man's fists are actually rocket-propelled off his body to strike his opposition from afar. It's a dastardly tactic, but it's weighed out by the fact that Hard Man himself is a rather fair-minded and honest individual. While admittedly somewhat of a lazy bones, his primary battle tactic is to always ensure that he and his opponent are on equal ground, obviously before the inevitable result where he humiliatingly crushes his foe in fair combat. However, this mindset puts the forthright giant at odds with the more pragmatic Snake Man. Aside from his work, Hard Man's main hobby is Sumo Wrestling, and he has a fear of water after being pushed into a swimming pool by Snake Man. Those two are just never gonna get along...
hard-man.skill_description: Protects the robot's defense stat from being reduced
hard-man.skill_description2: The robot's defense stat cannot be lowered and any attempts to reduce it will have no effect.

quotes.battle_start: Let's have ourselves a fair and honest fight.
quotes.battle_taunt: Think harder -- Nothing can penetrate my ceratanium defenses!
quotes.battle_victory: Understand that nothing's better than an honest loss... besides an honest win, that is.
quotes.battle_defeat: Ohh.. what a bother. I'm sorry, {this_player}...

top-man.name: Top Man
top-man.description2: Spin, spin, spin to win! That's Top Man's prime philosophy in life, a Robot Master created during Light and Wily's truce-based partnership to locate Energy Elements. To be entirely honest, a robot who spins doesn't seem entirely useful for mining alien compounds, but nor does it really matter; Top Man went on to face Mega Man in combat using his dizzying Top Spin attack. This technique causes Top Man to sprout out miniature tops, and while on initial impact it's admittedly weak, its strength comes from the tops hitting continuously to stack up damage. And while one can easily surmise this themselves, Top Man's also capable of spinning his body rapidly (although only for his own amusement; it's awfully ineffective at actually hitting people!) As for his personality, Top Man specializes in making arrangements on Dr. Wily's behalf, being somewhat of a smooth talker. However, his character is most brilliantly displayed through his actions-- specifically, the action of dance! A superb dancer known for pushing his luck, he moves gracefully and smoothly, with his absolute favorite being Ballroom Dance. Alas, while he initially had dreams of stardom in his youth, reality slowly crept in and faded his hopes, Top Man now settling for being a dance instructor in his free time. Kinda makes all that spinning sadder when it's all a facade for his crushed dreams, huh?
top-man.skill_description: The robot spins away negative field hazards after each turn
top-man.skill_description2: The robot spins away negative field hazards affecting it or its position at the end of each turn.

quotes.battle_start: The floor's been set, {target_robot}! Let's dance!
quotes.battle_taunt: Yeah, yeah, we're really rolling now!
quotes.battle_victory: Dropping out already? D'aw, I hardly started spinning!
quotes.battle_defeat: Augh, now my head's the thing spinning...

snake-man.name: Snake Man
snake-man.description2: Someone has to traverse through narrow places no human could squeeze into, hence the conception of Snake Man. Unfortunately, Snake Man himself wasn't too fond of his occupation, and thus gladly took on the proposition to make Mega Man his prey! It's with this hunter mindset that Snake Man's battle tactics are entirely spun off of, utilizing and relying on ambush techniques in order to use the element of surprise to completely overwhelm opponents. And while Snake Man doesn't have any weapons that rely completely on force, he keeps track of prey through the usage of camouflaged miniature snakes, dubbed the "Search Snakes." Fitting with his snake-ish appearance, Snake Man's vile and deceptive, a sneaky creature that revels in the cornering of all prey! This has led to multiple moral clashes between him and the mighty giant, Hard Man, whose beliefs in a fair and just battle naturally counter Snake Man's more behind-the-scenes mindset. Not everyone is Snake Man's enemy however, as he's known to find his comfort with his buddy, Toad Man; reportedly, this feeling is not mutual. Tenacity to a foul mindset, much like venom to a forked tongue, is a much too dangerous concoction to ever exist. Sadly, Snake Man's that exact dangerous mix!
snake-man.skill_description: The robot's stats are boosted when it senses prey nearby
snake-man.skill_description2: All of the robot's stats are boosted by one stage when it senses potential prey on the field.

quotes.battle_start: The hunt beginsss.... It'sss foolisssh to try running!
quotes.battle_taunt: Come out, come out, wherever you are...
quotes.battle_victory: Another prey to fall into my jawssss....
quotes.battle_defeat: I wasssn't the hunter... I wassss the hunted!

spark-man.name: Spark Man
spark-man.description2: Spark Man is, in essence, the technical successor to Dr. Light's research on Elec Man, foregoing palm electrical control and an ergonomic build to produce twice the electrical output that his predecessor could. By all means, Spark Man would be an obvious improvement over Elec Man-- that is, save for one itsy-bitsy oversight Drs. Light and Wily failed to account for. Spark Man's way too scatterbrained to have the focus to produce that much energy! As a result, Spark Man's signature "Spark Shot" attack-- which was calculated to be more offensively viable than the Thunder Beam-- instead only completely paralyzes the target instead. Despite not living up to his electrical potential, Spark Man doesn't really seem to care; he is awfully scatter-brained after all! Rather than sparking a war, he's more suited towards finding sparks of friendship, willing to befriend any robot no matter their threat or intimidation level. And his favorite place to take his friends? The "Seaside Town Aquarium", home to a myriad of different forms of sea-life, with his obvious favorite being the electric eel. Naturally, Spark Man's pleas of saccharine friendship quickly gets on the nerves of his teammates, but it's a burden they often have to tough out; while those needles aren't offensively viable, they're great in patch-ups and repairs! However, Needle Man seems to be deathly afraid of being friends with Spark Man.... But that doesn't stop Spark Man!
spark-man.skill_description: The robot heals wounded allies from the bench at the end of each turn
spark-man.skill_description2: The robot tries to support its friends from the bench by restoring some of their lost health after each turn.

quotes.battle_start: I feel a spark between us...let's be friends?
quotes.battle_taunt: Don't do anything crazy, {target_robot}! We don't want to spark a war...
quotes.battle_victory: Oh no, did I hurt you?  Guess I don't know my own power...
quotes.battle_defeat: I'm shocked!  I thought we were friends...

shadow-man.name: Shadow Man
shadow-man.description2: Discarded and buried away in the confines of a temple long forgotten to time, Dr. Wily ran into Shadow Man rather unexpectedly yet fortunately, as he was swiftly given a prominent position in Dr. Wily's nefarious scheme to take ownership of the mined Energy Elements. Rumors have circulated that Shadow Man is of extraterrestrial origin, stemming from his inexplicable background and the fact that his trademark weapon, the Shadow Blade, is entirely coated with some sort of substance not of this world. Oddly enough, despite the possible alien background, Shadow Man's somehow an expert in Earth-based ninjutsu techniques, able to perform basic illusory tricks, transformations into objects like logs, and summoning frogs.... All taken together, it's incredibly weird, but perhaps that's part of the mystery? Regardless, he's been often described as having a shallow mindset, and impulsive in nature. Above all else, Shadow Man seeks to uphold the honorifics of his class, with an intensive knack and interest towards capturing the surprise of both his enemies and allies. Naturally, following the ninja way, Shadow Man is easily one of the most dedicated robots to Dr. Wily's cause and ideals. So much so, in fact, that Shadow Man began illustrating and writing his own manga, "Shadow Man Megamix", in his free time to provide further funding to Dr. Wily's resources! An extraterrestrial start, ninja gimmicks, a penchant for surprise, a manga author... Shadow Man's one mysterious robot.
shadow-man.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's attack on Space-type fields
shadow-man.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is extraordinarily boosted by three stages when the Space-type field multiplier is high.

quotes.battle_start: Shameful ronin... I, {this_robot}, will be your opponent!
quotes.battle_taunt: Run and hide, but your shadow always follows.
quotes.battle_victory: No one can escape their shadow. This is your final burial!
quotes.battle_defeat: Imagine me, being surprised... You are a worthy opponent.

bright-man.name: Bright Man
bright-man.description2: Get the "bright guy" puns out of the way now-- although don't disregard it entirely! Bright Man was Dr. Cossack's prefatory work, with the prime purpose of aiding expeditions by always keeping their environment well-lighted and accounted for. However, as all robots typically must in a world ridden with mechanical dysfunction, Bright Man had to eventually be modified for use in combat, much to Dr. Cossack's chagrin. Yet, Bright Man's means of attack are nontraditional; instead of a physical object, Bright Man overrides his lighting to over ten million watts, causing any nearby robots' preemptive safety measures to override their systems and temporarily shut down their movement. To put things into perspective, ten million watts can temporarily sustain a small to mid-average warship cruiser (as one may imagine, Bright Man is an energy-conserving nightmare!) Even brighter than his flash, however, is his mind, as Bright Man has multiple credentials to his name! In fact, Dr. Cossack was able to arrange Bright Man a position at the nationally-acclaimed "Stravinsky Science Academy", although ultimately he was fired for keeping his students after class for a grueling hour to listen to his various anecdotes. Nonetheless, out of the classroom and in the battlefield, Bright Man tends to be somewhat of a pacifistic coward, but a coward that holds it above all else to help his allies! Just, maybe only if all the stronger robots don't show up that day...

quotes.battle_start: C-come on, {target_robot}... Surely two enlightened robots shouldn't fight?
quotes.battle_taunt: Aha! Eureka! I've got you all figured out now!
quotes.battle_victory: Oh, lighten up, won't you? You can't outsmart a genius!
quotes.battle_defeat: I have not failed! I just.. tested a way not to win, is all!

toad-man.name: Toad Man
toad-man.description2: Dr. Cossack was already quite the accomplished individual in the robotics community, so imagine the glares of skepticism he was met with when he revealed Toad Man! Now, in all fairness, beyond his amphibian physique, Toad Man fulfills his agricultural purpose with the utmost efficiency, due to his Rain Flush equipment. He begins by rocketing a pod of vapor into the sky, which evidently forms into a shower of rain drops to assuage crop droughts; in times of combat, he utilizes acidic rain instead, benign to humans yet absolutely devastating for any robot's armor. Of course, as a toad-themed robot, his jumping prowess is something to behold, and has earned a long-jumping position in Russia's Robot Olympics team. Toad Man has also furthered his agricultural dedication by researching and experimenting with natural sciences, but most of all he has a fond appreciation of all types of music! ...Of course, his appreciation is unknowingly hindered due to the fact he's tone-deaf! But, even with his poor hearing, Toad Man's an absolute crowd controller on the battlefield, keeping waves of threatening robots away with his killer Rain Flush. Well, that, or maybe no one wants to get near that weird, slimy frog-skin of his...?
toad-man.skill_description: The robot's stats are boosted to protect nearby plants
toad-man.skill_description2: The robot's roots compel it to protect nearby flora by boosting its own stats when plants are on the field.

quotes.battle_start: Oh, here comes the rain again~
quotes.battle_taunt: Did you say something? I can barely hear you...
quotes.battle_victory: I may be an amphibian, but I'm still quite dignified!.... *ribbit!*
quotes.battle_defeat: Yikes! I'd better hop on outta here...

drill-man.name: Drill Man
drill-man.description2: Drill Man isn't particularly a robot with much variance or creative liberty going on with his design; he's called Drill Man because all he has is three distinct drills! Chalk it up to Dr. Cossack for not being much with visual pizzazz, but chances are Drill Man doesn't mind either way! As one would expect from his namesake, Drill Man's profession lies in drilling through the most dense of minerals, a complete aficionado when it comes to barraging the ground to its basics! And when austere drilling doesn't get the job done, Drill Man cuts to the chase by simply blowing up the job to itty-bitty little smithereens, bypassing both nature and safety limitations! These methods mirror the traits of their master, as Drill Man is as haphazard as they come. Calculations and planning ahead are nothing more than affirmations for his surely-always-correct gut feeling, so why bother with all the honorifics when you can get the job done in record time? Yes, this has worked out for Drill Man multiple times in the past, as he was lauded for his keen and nimble work in finding a long-forgotten gold mine! But, on the other end of the spectrum, Drill Man's hasty work ended up sinking most of his company's equipment and buildings. Whoops.
drill-man.skill_description: Allows the robot to find rare minerals during battle
drill-man.skill_description2: The robot intermittently drills the ground below its feet looking for rare minerals like shards and cores.

quotes.battle_start: Let's speed this along, I know the drill!
quotes.battle_taunt: I can't get anywhere with all these stupid rules and safety precautions! Let's just rush this job!
quotes.battle_victory: Aha, see that? Always better to ask forgiveness than for permission!
quotes.battle_defeat: I'm gonna need you to lend me a hand, 'cause I don't seem to have any...

pharaoh-man.name: Pharaoh Man
pharaoh-man.description2: After demonstrating a clear fascination towards Egyptian culture and history at university, Dr. Cossack constructed Pharaoh Man on that clear fascination in order to navigate and explore antediluvian pyramids and ruins. Besides an astute sense of trap analysis, Pharaoh Man can, much like his brother unit Bright Man, light paths ahead of him using condensed solar energy. Likewise, he's able to launch the solar energy, henceforth referred to as the "Pharaoh Shot", in an offensive manner whenever he's stuck in a pinch! As his appearance would suggest, Pharaoh Man is a born leader, carrying an exemplary sense of verbosity, grandiosity, and gravitas! Eventually, Pharaoh Man swiftly began to take charge of the expeditions he was placed on, ultimately not requiring the assistance of human coworkers and commanding over 1000 different mechas! As this commendable description illustrates, Pharaoh Man appears to be a robot without a flaw to be had.... that is, he would be! However, for as grand as Pharaoh Man is, he transforms into a timid whelp the instant he sees a beautiful woman! The 1000-mecha army, the leadership skills, the grand demeanor doesn't mean anything if you can make Pharaoh Man blush!
pharaoh-man.skill_description: The robot boosts its defense stat in the presence of girls
pharaoh-man.skill_description2: The robot's defense stat is boosted two stages for each girl bot noticed on the field.

quotes.battle_start: So the sun god commands me to succeed. So it shall be done!
quotes.battle_taunt: You are only but a grain of sand in my wide kingdom of desert!
quotes.battle_victory: Kneel to me now, and the sun god may yet have mercy upon you.
quotes.battle_defeat: The sun shines upon my kingdom no more...

ring-man.name: Ring Man
ring-man.description2: The ultimatum of combat is to destroy the opponent beyond resistance, isn't it? That may be the case, but pacifistic as he is, Dr. Cossack designed the robot Ring Man to break combat traditions and constrain opponents instead, with the usage of his signature palliative rings. Don't let that fool you, though; that ring still packs a punch! Especially when Ring Man effortlessly hurdles the ring, just before surprising the opponent as his ring boomerangs right back to him! Surprise is essential to Ring Man's fighting style after all, as he's a strategist and tactician that takes any logical opportunity to catch an enemy by their backs. Unfortunately, as a result, he's somewhat smug in attitude and unwilling to show mercy, no matter how deserved, towards his defeated foes. He's a letter-of-the-law individual, which needs to be pointed out as Ring Man's a member of Interpol, facilitating international police efforts and working alongside local policemen and federal agents alike. When he's not busy kicking crime by the proverbial heinie, he's known to be quite affluent in quoits (for the uninitiated, a ring-tossed game), and, barring his adorable princess Kalinka Cossack, has a pungent dislike of kids, toddlers and teens. A combat robot meant to detain rather than fight, Ring Man's an awfully admirable guy. He'd probably make a great best man at a wedding, too!

quotes.battle_start: Expect no mercy, {target_robot}! I'm here to stop you!
quotes.battle_taunt: Right into my hands, {target_robot}.. this is the moment I've been waiting for!
quotes.battle_victory: Success! I thank the stars for this victory!
quotes.battle_defeat: I'm sorry, {this_player}... I'm just not as strong as everyone else...

dust-man.name: Dust Man
dust-man.description2: There's nothing much to disguise or sweeten here; Dr. Cossack entirely designed Dust Man around the concept of being a vacuum cleaner. While a robot made for cleaning servitude is rather archaic and certainly raises a robot rights question, Dust Man wouldn't be the one asking, as he's dedicated to cleaning up every corpuscle of trash he can! His suction is extremely powerful, albeit Dust Man's overeager attitude often causes him to be inundated with debris and dust. With his eye on the malicious, Dr. Wily quickly took note of this flaw, and much to Cossack's protest, outfitted Dust Man with an ability to launch extra volatile stage debris from his vacuum, henceforth christened the "Dust Crusher". An eager sanitation robot, Dust Man's all for spring cleaning, but as aforementioned, he does tend to overestimate his suction. As a result of this, he has somewhat poor confidence in his own capabilities. Other things of notice is that he's often been known to have a severe case of bad breath, as well as a vehement fear of all sorts of rodents. As an asset in battle, Dust Man's surprisingly an unexpected threat, as while other robots can throw fireballs and flip gravity, Dust Man's suction and exhaling has a simple effectiveness and strength to it. And, free of charge, he'll clean up any messes on the battlefield afterwards!
dust-man.skill_description: Gives a stat pellet or capsule to an ally-in-need at end-of-turn
dust-man.skill_description2: The robot's head-mounted exhaust pipe is constantly getting clogged with stat-boosting pellets and capsules, forcing the robot to offload extras on its allies whenever they seem down on their luck.

quotes.battle_start: You wanna fight? I'll try not to suck too much...
quotes.battle_taunt: ah.. ACHOO!!!.. Oh, my poor aching sinuses...
quotes.battle_victory: Oh no! Is this one of your parts?... Um, do you need this back?
quotes.battle_defeat: Drats, I overdid it once again. I'm such a mess...

dive-man.name: Dive Man
dive-man.description2: Often when the public thinks of nautical Robot Masters, their first thoughts tend to drift towards certain scalawag pirates, aquatic mermaids, and pathetic bubble-flinging users; Dive Man is none of those things, for he is a robot grounded in mechanical realism and the most dedicated sense of naval code you've ever seen. Dr. Cossack was inspired to create Dive Man after reminiscing off of the old nationalist tales of his youth, about daring sea and submarine captains with an impeccable sense of drive towards serving the greater good. Dive Man encapsulates all these qualities, although he's really more of a submarine than a proper submarine captain; he's outfitted with homing torpedoes able to be burst out of his chest. And, due to a serendipitous design flaw, Dive Man can launch HIMSELF rapidly and dizzying, his go-to surprise attack when all else fails. It's important to emphasize that's entirely a last-resort move: not because of any massive stamina drain, but rather Dive Man occasionally suffers from an extreme case of motion sickness. Regardless, much like Cossack intended, Dive Man is the ideal sea captain, a figure who's trust-worthy, noble, an eager listener, and the utter epitome of a navy man. These attracting qualities put him at odds with his maritime foil, Pirate Man. But, whether he's friend or foe, Dive Man is nothing short of respectable. Just don't let him get too seasick, okay? Robot vomit is probably kind of gross.
dive-man.skill_description: Boosts the robot's speed on Water-type fields
dive-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat is boosted by one stage at the end of each turn when the Water-type field multiplier is high.

quotes.battle_start: {target_robot}?... Well, a target's a target, no matter the orders.
quotes.battle_taunt: Don't bother running, my torpedos are inescapable!
quotes.battle_victory: Sea or land, it doesn't make a difference; I always get my targets!
quotes.battle_defeat: Yuck. I feel seasick... blech!

skull-man.name: Skull Man
skull-man.description2: As Dr. Cossack's repertoire only included a total of seven Robot Masters to be pushed forth against Mega Man, one can reasonably infer that Skull Man was a desperate effort scrambled together by the morally-entrapped doctor, with his theme an obvious nod to his captor as well. Thus, in contrast to the functional designs of his other robots, Skull Man's entirely centered around nothing short of pure combat, being the culmination of Cossack's technical knowledge while embodying nothing of his ideals. His strikes are tuned to be precise and killer, yet he can guarantee absolute invulnerability with his Skull Barrier, generating nightmarish skulls for an unexpected defense. Coupled with this is his strategic mindset; it's said Skull Man would willingly stand still indefinitely until his opponent made the first movement. However, being 100% combat at all times... has proven to be an issue in a restoration lifestyle. Skull Man has no sense of purpose nor social affability, and so has resigned himself to a lonely existence. He revels alone in the macabre, and watches horror movies all by his lonesome... At least, he did, until he found out Kalinka was also a fervent fan of horror as well! Still, with such a tragic and destitute background, it's hard not to feel bad for the guy.... Well, unless he's crushing you in battle, that is...
skull-man.skill_description: The robot does extra damage when the target has a weakness
skull-man.skill_description2: The robot exploits the targets weaknesses by doing even more damage when it knows it has an advantage.

quotes.battle_start: Now, {target_robot}! Let's get ready to rumble!
quotes.battle_taunt: Fight me! FIGHT ME! Battles like these are what I live for!
quotes.battle_victory: Mwahahaha! Your execution was my pleasure!
quotes.battle_defeat: I can't deal with these feelings... Why can't I just punch my stupid emotions?!

gravity-man.name: Gravity Man
gravity-man.description2: Gravity Man is a Robot Master like no other. Dr. Wily could have easily outshined Light with his pioneering of gravity distortion technology, but instead he made a robot out of it. At least Gravity Man puts it to good use! He likes to keep him and his opponent on separate planes to disrupt their strategies. However, this tactic is about all he has going for him in combat. Gravity Man is more interested in furthering the field of gravitational studies with his revolutionary research. Unfortunately, this involves confronting a lot of skeptics. A group of scientists once claimed the gravity shtick was a parlor trick done with superconducting magnets. Gravity Man responded by tossing a Redwood into their institute. He might seem a little distant, but maybe a reminder of space’s vast gravitational pulls will bring him back down to Earth. Gravity Man could use some grounding.

quotes.battle_start: I'm going to turn your entire world upside down!
quotes.battle_taunt: What's wrong? Has my gravity-switching made you dizzy?
quotes.battle_victory: It seems you didn't understand the gravity of the situation.
quotes.battle_defeat: And yet the Earth does move...

wave-man.name: Wave Man
wave-man.description2: Designed to be taken marginally more seriously than Bubble Man, Wave Man is the first Amphibious Combat Robot Master that lives up to the title. For starters, he can move effectively both on the land and in the water! Equipped with the Water Wave, Wave Man pumps water into the ground, causing geysers to erupt from random spots when the pressure reaches a breaking point. While good as a crowd control move, the attack lacks precision, so Wave Man is also equipped with a Harpoon cannon. However, even when used in tandem, this combination can’t defend Wave Man from close-range combat. Working on the ocean floor, it is rare Wave Man would meet anything with consciousness, and his propensity for long range combat means he consciously avoids any form of contact. It’s probably this lack of social interaction that’s makes him so moody. Wave Man alternates between contemplative loneliness, miserable sorrow, and violent rages. These mood swings mostly happen at random, the only consistent trigger being pollution. Encountering aquatic contaminants, especially sludge, will throw Wave Man into a tantrum. Trying to use sludge against him probably isn’t worth the risk, as it’s easier to deal with a nervous Wave Man than an angry one.
wave-man.skill_description: The robot can inflict Water type damage without resistance
wave-man.skill_description2: The robot ignores resistances and negative multipliers when dealing Water-type damage to targets.

quotes.battle_start: ... Hey, who said you could come here? Go away!
quotes.battle_taunt: Grr, mind your personal space already! I swear I'll harpoon you!
quotes.battle_victory: At least now I can get some peace and quiet....
quotes.battle_defeat: I just wanna be alone! Is that really too much to ask?

stone-man.name: Stone Man
stone-man.description2: Dr. Wily has created Robot Masters faster than the speed of sound, capable of stopping time, and hotter than the surface of the sun, and for his most diabolical scheme yet, Wily will finally destroy Mega Man once and for all… by hitting him with a rock. Well, a lot of rocks to be precise. Stone Man is as imposing as he looks, destroying enemy robots with all the resilience of a brick wall. Using the Power Stone, Stone Man orbits large rocks around the battlefield, limiting his opponent’s movement, leaving them open for strong physical blows. Stone Man’s bricks are near impossible to scratch, let alone destroy, making them individually incredibly durable. Trying to hold them all together, however, is another story. This might seem like a weakness, but Stone Man uses this trait to his advantage, rolling with his opponent’s punches by crumbling and reforming to brace attacks. Stone Man has grown quite accustomed to throwing his weight around, knowing he can get up again if he gets knocked down. It’s this persistence that led Stone Man to form a strong friendship with Guts Man, having finally found someone he can pal around with without one of them accidentally destroying the other. Unfortunately, Guts Man does not share the enthusiasm Stone Man has for film, but they still find their common ground, hanging out in oil bars. Until they get kicked out for roughhousing, anyways.

quotes.battle_start: You can't break my body, {target_robot}, and you DEFINITELY can't break my will!
quotes.battle_taunt: Y'know, this reminds me of this part in a movie where.. oh, sorry, fight first.
quotes.battle_victory: Real strength ain't just power! It's about picking up the pieces when everything falls apart!
quotes.battle_defeat: Uhhh, by now I'm supposed to form back together... uh oh.

gyro-man.name: Gyro Man
gyro-man.description2: Even the craziest of mad scientists can have an idea that flops. Dr. Wily intended to create an airborne Robot Master using a new theoretical form of rocket propulsion, but when it failed to come to fruition, Wily decided to cut his losses and attached a propeller to the unfinished Robot Master. Gyro Man doesn’t seem to mind though, using his propellers to their fullest in both mobility and combat. In the air, Gyro Man is uncontested, and he knows it. Gyro Man will belittle his opponents (and sometimes allies) from the safety of the skies, sometimes tauntingly diving down just out of reach. You might think he’s all bark and no bite, but Gyro Man can back up his aerial bombardment of jeers with the Gyro Attack. A speeding rotating blade is hard enough to deal with, but Gyro Man’s ability to remotely redirect the attack allows him to hit the most evasive foes. Few Robot Masters have bested Gyro Man on the battlefield, and even fewer still have done so while also earning his respect, the sore loser decrying techniques like gravity distortion as “cheap tricks.” Ironically, those who have met Gyro Man’s standards, like Quick Man and Tengu Man, ended up treating Gyro Man with the same contempt he treats so many others with. Why are all the fast Robot Masters such egomaniacs?

quotes.battle_start: I feel the need... the need for speed!
quotes.battle_taunt: In the air, {this_robot} has no worries -- not even any jet engine-using cheaters!
quotes.battle_victory: Mission complete! {this_player}, you can be my wingman anytime!
quotes.battle_defeat: {this_robot} down, {this_robot} down! Mayday, mayday, mayday!

star-man.name: Star Man
star-man.description2: Among Dr. Wily’s catalogue of Robot Masters, Star Man stands out as one of the most eccentric, and that’s saying something. Intended to maintain an abandoned space station, Star Man was designed to work under variable gravity fields. Space Debris has become exponentially more common in the year 20XX, so Dr. Wily also outfitted Star Man with the Star Crash so that he could protect himself, a defensive weapon not unlike those of Skull Man or Wood Man. Star Man has anything but a shielded personality, though. A romanticist deeply in love with the thespian arts, Star Man has found great success in film, much to the chagrin of Flash Man. You’d think it was all the time control and gravity distortion technology that drained Dr. Wily’s wallet, but it was actually the costs of Star Man’s early filmography that exhausted his bank account. Dr. Wily had to focus so heavily on saving money in Gyro and Crystal Man’s designs just to fund the special effects of Star Man’s first space opera! Star Man’s sentimental personality annoys his more pragmatic minded brethren, isolating the intergalactic Robot Master even further. It’s lonely out in space, and despite his constant requests, Dr. Wily has yet to make a companion for Star Man. Poor Star Man seems doomed to burn out his fuse up there all alone….

quotes.battle_start: This isn't for me or {this_player}... this is for all the love in the universe!
quotes.battle_taunt: I'm the world's 'Splendid Noble Youth!' My stars will defend all!
quotes.battle_victory: There may be billions of stars out there, but there's only one {this_robot}!
quotes.battle_defeat: There's always show business, I suppose...

charge-man.name: Charge Man
charge-man.description2: Arriving right on time on the battlefield is Charge Man, a Robot Master created by Dr. Wily to resemble a train. Well, maybe calling it a resemblance sells Charge Man short: he also functions like a steam locomotive, requiring coal and water to run. While this archaic energy system is hard to maintain, the energy production is incredible, allowing Charge Man to ram into foes with all the force of a derailed train. For enemies that call for ranged attacks, Charge Man can simply shoot out the very flaming coal that powers him. That stuff burns hot, so getting hit by it will hurt a lot! The Charge Kick is usually all he needs though, because if he gets enough momentum going, nothing is stopping him from running you down. This one-track battle tactic and his nostalgic design aren’t the only things old fashioned about him. Hard working and honest, yet stubborn and neophobic, Charge Man is a real old chunk of coal. He’ll bemoan the loss of the “good ol’ days” and how much simpler things were, even though the artificial intelligence that gives him life is a distinctly 20XX advancement. Funny he’s brothers with the Gravity Distortion and Space Exploration Robot Masters then. At least he gets along with Gyro Man, the two of them both taking pride in their respective antiquated technologies. Just don’t ask who’s faster; their feud will last for days.
charge-man.skill_description: Protects the robot's speed stat from being reduced
charge-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat can only be raised and any attempts to reduce it will have no effect.

quotes.battle_start: All aboard!
quotes.battle_taunt: I think I can, I think I can...
quotes.battle_victory: The pain train is pulling into the station!
quotes.battle_defeat: Back in my day, we used to respect our elders!

napalm-man.name: Napalm Man
napalm-man.description2: Napalm Man is a true Swiss Army Knife of weaponry! Dr. Wily built the walking tank to protect his secret weapons factory, which fostered a great passion for artillery in the Robot Master. His armament of choice is the Napalm Bomb, a small peanut shaped capsule that bounces around daintily… until it erupts into a violent explosion of sticky napalm! His intimidating appearance scares most away, but in truth, Napalm Man is no warmonger.
