He is fiercely loyal and personable to those he gets close to and his love for weaponry comes across more like a nerdy hobby than a blood-- er, oil lust. No, Napalm loves weaponry and identifies it as a true art form, preserving that he deems beautiful. Maybe that’s why he once blew up his own weapons museum; art is fleeting!

quotes.battle_start: I love the smell of me in the morning!
quotes.battle_taunt: Your weapon will look great in my collection!
quotes.battle_victory: Explosions are music to my audio receptors!
quotes.battle_defeat: That was a good strategy...

crystal-man.name: Crystal Man
crystal-man.description2: It was between the framing of Dr. Cossack and Proto Man that Dr. Wily realized his previously accumulated money would not last forever. To fund his future world domination endeavors, Dr. Wily created Crystal Man. Using hydrothermal synthesis, Crystal Man can grow crystals by altering the atomic lattice of minerals using intense heat and high vapor pressures. Crystal Man was able to sell these crystals to laboratories for a while, but once the word got out on who his creator was, customers grew suspicious and the cash flow ceased. Not one to let a Robot Master become obsolete, Dr. Wily decided to repurpose Crystal Man into a combat robot. Crystal Man can form the Crystal Eye, a large gemstone designed to splinter apart upon contact, sending sharp debris across the battlefield. In addition, Crystal Man can use the Crystal Mind, a trick he picked up in his side endeavors that enables him to heighten his senses. Crystal Man proved to be effective in this new role, but felt unfulfilled, not meeting his initially programmed goal of making dough. He started fortune telling on the side, specifically to stick it to the scientists he no longer worked with. His gemstones were genuinely high quality, and if they couldn’t appreciate that, he would dedicate his schemes to upending people’s faith in those self-righteous hacks!

quotes.battle_start: I'm afraid your demise draws ever nearer...
quotes.battle_taunt: What does your future hold for you? I'm afraid that... I see nothing!
quotes.battle_victory: Hey, I was right! Err.. as I had foretold, of course.
quotes.battle_defeat: No, no, my crystals! How am I supposed to make any money now?!

blizzard-man.name: Blizzard Man
blizzard-man.description2: Blizzard Man was originally built by Canadian engineers to monitor weather patterns in Marie Byrd Land. Unsurprisingly, being surrounded by nothing but ice and snow can get pretty boring, and soon Blizzard Man longed for greener pastures, both metaphorically and literally. Using his Antarctic exploration skills, Blizzard Man tried competitive skiing, which he quickly found success in. This Canuck has gotten three golden metals in the Robot Olympics for skiing… in a row! He discovered a true passion for all aspects of competitive events, including sportscasting various winter sports and helping to set up the snowy slopes in warmer climates. Blizzard Man does so by using the artificial snow maker he received in exchange for his meteorological equipment, which incidentally allows him to create the deadly Blizzard Attack, a flurry of sharp ice crystals he can fire at his opponents. It is this move that got Blizzard Man entered as a contestant in the First Annual Robot Master Tournament in the first place, as he was originally attending to commentate! After a quick failed stint being reprogrammed and helping Dr. Wi- er, Mr. X, take over the world, Blizzard Man settled down as a weather forecaster, combining his meteorological work and his commentating abilities. Don’t count Blizzard Man out yet though; dashing through snow and enemies alike, Blizzard Man is sure to outcompete his opponents on the battlefield.
blizzard-man.skill_description: Boosts the robot's speed on Freeze-type fields
blizzard-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat is boosted by one stage at the end of each turn when the Freeze-type field multiplier is high.

quotes.battle_start: Say {target_robot}, you're a regular old gaper, eh?
quotes.battle_taunt: Is that how you treat a three-time gold medal winner? Hit the slopes, kid!
quotes.battle_victory: O, Canada! Our home and native land!
quotes.battle_defeat: ... I much prefer skiing to fighting, thank you very much.

centaur-man.name: Centaur Man
centaur-man.description2: Centaur Man, the first quadrupedal Robot Master, was originally created to be a tour guide for a museum in Greece. That might sound like overkill, but this museum held some of the most historically significant artifacts in all of Europe, so the imposing figure of the eight-foot Robot Master was deemed appropriate. If his stature wasn’t enough to give troublemakers pause, Centaur Man could use the Centaur Flash, creating a dimensional distortion to stop his targets in their tracks. The technique causes no direct harm to its quarry, but its combat potential was obvious to Centaur Man, which is why he decided to enlist in the First Annual Robot Master Tournament, exercising his otherwise dormant competitive nature. He performed well by using carefully premeditated strategies, but ultimately fell to Mega Man. This skirmish revealed the insane power of the Centaur Flash to the rest of the world, so Centaur Man was pressured out of combat by the international robotics community. The dejected Robot Master had to seek other forms of competition, and ultimately settled on losing all his zenny in the casino. You’d think someone as thoughtful as Centaur Man would choose a pastime more virtuous than gambling, or at the very least one he was better at. Alas, Centaur Man bombs at the poker and blackjack tables alike, his horns giving away any attempt at a poker face. At least he seems to have a good track record betting on the ponies.

quotes.battle_start: Say, I've placed my bets on winning... I'll split the cash if you give up now!
quotes.battle_taunt: When it comes to my money, you bet I'm running on pure horsepower!
quotes.battle_victory: My money! I've finally won it back! But... one more bet couldn't hurt, right?
quotes.battle_defeat: It's all about the spur of the moment... why do I never learn?

flame-man.name: Flame Man
flame-man.description2: Most Robot Masters in the year 20XX run off solar energy, thanks to how much control over the weather mankind had achieved. However, when making a robot master who works under the smoke-filled skies of an oil-fired power plant, it makes more sense to indulge in some of that fuel, doesn’t it? This was the philosophy behind Flame Man, and the project achieved great success… ignoring the fact he needs to fill up three times a day. Flame Man doesn’t seem to mind, having been influenced by this strict time limit to embrace punctuality and discipline. His self-maintenance is meticulous, always taking scrupulous care of his oil reserves and facial hair alike. Flame Man quickly proved himself to be an effective worker, and this dedication won him the Saudi Arabian nomination for the First Annual Robot Master Tournament. Flame Man can channel the intense heat of his power production to fire off small flames from his buster. This attack has minimal cost on his supply of oil, but in serious combat, Flame Man can exhaust it further by unleashing the deadly Flame Blast, a pillar of flame that can erupt from any surface. Flame Man demonstrated this arsenal to great effect… until being reprogrammed and forced to fight Mega Man. This dealt a major blow to his pride, and the only way he could gain back his confidence was to take even more painstaking care of his mustache. In the days directly following the tournament, he’d do nothing but refine his mustache between oil refills!

quotes.battle_start: Prepare, challenger, for the ferocious flames of the legendary {this_robot}!
quotes.battle_taunt: My energy's faltering... high time for an oil change.
quotes.battle_victory: There is no robot that is a better fighter, or has better facial hair, than {this_robot}!
quotes.battle_defeat: That's the last time I ever buy this ruddy discounted oil!

knight-man.name: Knight Man
knight-man.description2: Robot Masters’ combat abilities are usually designed to serve a specific role, whether that be self-defense or world domination. Knight Man is an exception; is combat itself not a worthy goal? Based on the knights of medieval history, Knight Man’s most noticeable feature is his incredible defense. Knight Man’s resilient armor can shrug off most minor hits, but the shield he carries makes him nearly impenetrable. He’s like a fortress on legs! Well, his armor is pretty heavy, so those legs aren’t winning him any races. Fortunately, Knight Man doesn’t need to worry about mobility when he wields impressive range and power. The Knight Crush is a deadly flail with a deceptively long chain, using its huge mass to plow through foes. Knight Man has used his mighty mace to smash through tons of robots, once reportedly defeating 1000 in a row… granted, it’s not clear if these were 1000 Robot Masters, or a bunch of Mets and Tellies. Either way, this hefty repertoire easily won Knight Man the United Kingdom nomination for the First Annual Robot Master Tournament, which was promptly upended by Mr. X’s evil scheme. Knight Man may be chivalrous, but Mr. X probably could have convinced Knight Man to willingly work for him, if only to get the chance to duel the famous Blue Bomber. Regardless, Mega Man bested the legendary warrior in combat, so with a win streak in ruins, Knight Man has appeared in the Prototype to do what he does best: fight!
knight-man.skill_description: Boosts the robot's defense upon disabling a target
knight-man.skill_description2: Continuing their victory streak, the robot automatically boosts their defense stat any time they successfully inflict a knockout in battle.

quotes.battle_start: Taste my steel, thou gorbellied knave!
quotes.battle_taunt: I bite my thumb at thee, knave! Verily, I bite it!
quotes.battle_victory: Methink'st I near my two-thousandth victory streak!
quotes.battle_defeat: Alas... they have killed me, {this_player}!

plant-man.name: Plant Man
plant-man.description2: Built by Pedro Astil, Plant Man was originally created to run a sulfuric acid producing chemical plant in Brazil. If you actually believed that, you clearly haven’t seen Plant Man, who was inspired by the rafflesia flower. The rafflesia doesn’t even grow in South America, but maybe it’s a good thing Plant Man’s design isn’t totally authentic; who would want a Robot Master that smells like rotten meat?! Instead, Plant Man smells as wonderful as the endangered flowers he was built to maintain in Brazil’s botanical gardens. His noble profession and extravagant design engraved Plant Man as a cultural icon of Brazil, and thus won him the Brazilian nomination for the First Annual Robot Master Tournament. Plant Man didn’t have the heart to decline it, but his reluctant acceptance didn’t change the fact he had no weapons to use. In response, Astil equipped Plant Man with the Plant Barrier, an orbiting satellite of petal decorated drones that Plant Man can summon and launch at will. Maybe Plant Man was right to fear this tournament, as he was reprogrammed by Mr. X in a plot to take over the world. After Mega Man defeated and freed the robots of the tournament, Plant Man returned to his gardens, continuing to care for rare and exotic flowers. It's sad, really. Such a talented Robot Master lacks the confidence to pursue any ventures beyond caring for his plants. At least he takes pride in that.
plant-man.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Nature-type abilities to only one unit
plant-man.skill_description2: The robot's abundance of green energy reduces the cost of its team's Nature-type abilities to only one unit.

quotes.battle_start: Nature... So beautiful, isn't it? I wanna cry just looking at it all...
quotes.battle_taunt: Wake up and smell the roses! See the beauty of this world!
quotes.battle_victory: These violent delights always have such violent ends! Why not just take up gardening instead?
quotes.battle_defeat: So dry... so wilted... need.. water!

tomahawk-man.name: Tomahawk Man
tomahawk-man.description2: After the announcement of the First Annual Robot Tournament, American engineers scrambled to create a US entrant. The result was Tomahawk Man, designed unsubtly after Native American iconography, including an interest in horseback riding; makes you wonder how he and Centaur Man get along. Tomahawk utilizes the Silver Tomahawk, a weapon he wields with both power and precision, reportedly being able to extinguish a candle with the weapon from over three hundred feet away. Being explicitly designed for the tournament, Tomahawk Man doesn’t have much of a relationship with his community or the fellow combatants in the tournament. Maybe that’s why Mr. X was able to reprogram him so easily? Even if he’s a Robot Master of few words, he’s not afraid to get up close and personal with his Silver Tomahawk and Feather Barrage attack. Try to use this lack of personal space against him.

quotes.battle_start: My will is unbreakable! Prepare yourself!
quotes.battle_taunt: Your courage is admirable. It is a shame we must meet here, on the battlefield…
quotes.battle_victory: The spirits of my fallen brethren will sleep soundly tonight....
quotes.battle_defeat: Your soul is strong, and brave, {target_robot}. I will fight no more.

wind-man.name: Wind Man
wind-man.description2: If the air around you starts getting breezier, and the scent of Ginger assaults your senses, Wind Man just might be making the scene! Hailing from China, Wind Man was originally designed for agricultural duties, firing off razor sharp winds to cut down crops and manipulating the local weather patterns with his 200 mile per hour Wind Storms. Although Wind Man was content with his work, he always secretly longed to demonstrate his Martial Art moves, his favorite past time next to cooking. Fortunately, he was given the chance to do so at the First Annual Robot Master Tournament! Unfortunately, it was secretly an evil scheme masterminded by Mr. X, resulting in Wind Man being reprogrammed and forced to fight Mega Man. Well, at least he still got to show off some cool moves in the process. Don’t let his bulky appearance deceive you: the engines in his feet allow him to zoom across the battlefield astonishingly quick, unleashing jet propelled tackles, kicks, and strikes on his opponents. Do not take this forward approach as a weakness; a great Martial Artist once said, “I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times… especially if that man has jet engines in his feet!”
wind-man.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Wind-type abilities to only one unit
wind-man.skill_description2: The robot's powerful body-mounted jet engines reduce the cost of its team's Wind-type abilities to only one unit.

quotes.battle_start: Get ready, {target_robot} -- I'll take my victory with only one strike!
quotes.battle_taunt: The wind can move both calmly and fiercely... my Kung Fu will be the same!
quotes.battle_victory: A well-earned victory tastes great... but the food I make tastes even sweeter!
quotes.battle_defeat: When a dish goes poorly, blame not the ingredients, but the chef...

yamato-man.name: Yamato Man
yamato-man.description2: Hailing from the dojos of Japan, striking fear into the hearts of adversaries with his mighty spear is Yamato Man! Built from the start to be a combat robot, Yamato Man commands the Yamato Spear, a javelin like weapon that fires out armor piercing spear tips rather than throwing the whole weapon. His supply is limited, however, so during long fights Yamato Man will have to recollect the spear tips. Fortunately, Yamato Man can keep up with this costly battle tactic thanks to his special armor. His purple plating is only used to deflect weaker attacks, as anything sturdier would weigh Yamato Man down and inhibit his ability to recover the spear tips. It’s unknown why Yamato Man only uses the Yamato Spear, as he is well versed in several martial arts and owns many Japanese swords. Maybe these are more like hobbies than backup combat techniques to Yamato Man, which would make sense seeing how laidback he is. Yamato Man is easygoing and a little on the shy side, living by the same style as his combat: honorably, justly, and calmly. While Yamato Man has always tried to uphold these principles, his belief in them was reinvigorated when he met the chivalrous Knight Man at the First Annual Robot Master Tournament. Yamato Man vowed to redouble his efforts, acting nobly like his newfound friend and inspiration… while abandoning the overly prideful parts. It’s a wonder this bond even formed, considering Yamato’s distaste for the English language, which Knight Man of course embodies with his representation of the United Kingdom. Maybe even the stoic Yamato Man finds Knight Man’s thespian dialect funny.
yamato-man.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's attack when in danger
yamato-man.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is boosted by two stages when they're pushed to the brink in battle.

quotes.battle_start: Watashi, dai Kazuo wa, anata o uchi makasu!
quotes.battle_taunt: Watashi no bushi no yari o osoreru!
quotes.battle_victory: Nagai Nihon wa raibu!
quotes.battle_defeat: Watashi wa Nihon, anata o shippaishita...

freeze-man.name: Freeze Man
freeze-man.description2: When Freeze Man appears on the battlefield, two things should become immediately apparent: the sudden drop in the surrounding temperature, and the gaudy poses he is making up on the spot. While most ice themed robot masters are perfectly capable of generating extreme colds, none compare to the complete mastering of temperature Freeze Man wields. Turning the laws of thermodynamics on their heads, Freeze Man can split air temperature into highs and lows, using the heat to power himself. The cold gets harnessed and used in combat, his primary weapon being the Freeze Cracker, a projectile shaped like a snowflake that splinters apart upon contact. It might be disingenuous to say this is where most of the cold goes, though. A lot of it just gets wasted on icy props and misty surroundings for Freeze Man’s egotistical entrances. As vain as Freeze Man can be, his dedication to looking cool comes from a desire to entertain as much as it is to impress. Also, it’s not like Freeze Man is incapable of appreciating others, his idolization of Ice Man as the progenitor to freezing Robot Masters and his desire for cleaning pollution standing out as prime examples. Well, maybe the latter of the two is not as selfless as it might seem. After all, how is Freeze Man supposed to look cool with a bunch of junk lying around?
freeze-man.skill_description: Decreases the Flame-type field multiplier on battle start
freeze-man.skill_description2: The robot decreases the Flame-type field multiplier upon entering battle by sucking all the hot air out of the room.

quotes.battle_start: Now that I'm in battle, expect a flawless victory, {this_player}!
quotes.battle_taunt: Check it out, {target_robot}! I'm gonna hit you with the ol' razzle dazzle!
quotes.battle_victory: Ooh, ooh, finally! Check out my super-awesome victory pose!
quotes.battle_defeat: Ohh.. I never rehearsed a cool losing pose, did I?

junk-man.name: Junk Man
junk-man.description2: After accepting he was forever going down in history as a mad scientist, Dr. Wily decided he might as well take inspiration from the classic examples, right? Taking a page right out of Frankenstein is Junk Man, a hulking mass of spare parts and debris held together by strong electromagnetic forces. Despite his bulky stature, Junk Man was initially created as a resource collection robot, using his grotesque appearance to blend into the piles of trash laying in junkyards, where Junk Man searches for parts Wily can salvage. Junk Man is diligent in this task, having gained quite a knack for valuing pilfered parts on the fly, making the most of his trash heap trips. He isn’t just an errand boy, though. Junk Man is perfectly capable of using all that collected litter in combat, most iconically in the form of the Junk Shield, using scrap metal to shore up his already imposing defenses. The most intact parts end up going to Wily, but ever the efficient worker, Junk Man makes use of any trash he can find, more than happy to attach even the grimiest of scraps to his body. The exception to this rule might be food waste, which never ceases to drive Junk Man up a wall. It’s not that hard guys: food and food contaminated containers, like coffee cups and pizza boxes, can’t be recycled! Do your part so Junk Man can do his.
junk-man.skill_description: Gives a life or weapon energy consumable to an ally-in-need at end-of-turn
junk-man.skill_description2: The robot's garbage-taste allows it to see what others don't see on the battlefield, and to salvage even junk into restorative pellets and capsules.  The robot likes to test these items out on wounded teammates.

quotes.battle_start: {target_robot}... Your parts will be useful!
quotes.battle_taunt: Gaze upon my form, perfection incarnate - and I'm eco-friendly, too!
quotes.battle_victory: Rest in peace, {target_robot}, and in pieces!
quotes.battle_defeat: Well, recycling's not too bad either. I guess.

burst-man.name: Burst Man
burst-man.description2: Created by Wily as a fail-safe in case he was ever jailed, Burst Man was stationed undercover in Edo. Burst Man was supposed to lie dormant in Edo, but being deployed in such a lively city had a formative effect on Burst Man, turning him into a happy-go-lucky Robot Master. Burst Man was giddy to perform at festivals, using the bombs Wily had designed for destructive combat instead as vibrant fireworks. A master at visual pizzazz, Burst Man uses the chemicals in his bubbles to modify his explosives, giving them different colorations and patterns. It’s fortunate he prefers to use his arsenal for leisurely activities, because otherwise he’d be a tricky opponent! His bubbles can coat the battlefield, either bursting to inflict splash damage, or more heinously, confining foes inside of them. In his most dangerous attack, Burst Man fires the Danger Wrap, a bomb encased in a bubble that can trap opponents before exploding, causing more damage due to its proximity. He never uses it to its fullest extent, however, as Burst Man tries to end fights as quickly as possible, fine with winning or losing, just to get back to his festivals. The only thing Burst Man hates more than fighting are extreme temperatures, as high hots and low colds can cause chain reactions in his bombs, ruining the more elaborate displays he has planned. Even if he’s not the best fighter, if you can find him on a temperate summer evening, you’ll be in for a show like no other.

quotes.battle_start: 3, 2, 1... Kaboom!
quotes.battle_taunt: I'd hate to burst your bubble, so don't burst mine!
quotes.battle_victory: Now THAT was a fireworks display!
quotes.battle_defeat: The party’s over? Aw, man!

cloud-man.name: Cloud Man
cloud-man.description2: Originally designed to be a weather control robot, Dr. Wily stole Cloud Man and repurposed him as a combat robot, planting him and three other Robot Masters in hiding as a backup plan should Wily ever be incarcerated. This roster of Robot Masters had varied responses to being stationed and forced to lie in wait, Cloud Man’s being an almost complete loss of the work ethic he developed in his previous career. The formerly patient Cloud Man became a couch potato and was now only interested in casting harsh thunderstorms, abandoning the variety of weather patterns in his former arsenal. It’s hard to argue with his preference for the raw power of lightning though! His Thunder Bolt attack can inflict some truly wicked damage, given it isn’t redirected by nearby lightning rods. Cloud Man can also summon cloudbursts to halt his opponent’s mobility. It’s a wonder Cloud Man himself isn’t impacted by his strong winds, considering he doesn’t have any legs or feet to anchor him to the ground. Maybe it’s appropriate Cloud Man is the only one capable of weathering these storms, considering his allies don’t want to be around him anyways. Cloud Man makes an insufferable teammate, spending more time in battles pranking his allies or trying to find an easy way out rather than actually fighting. However, if the stars align and Cloud Man finds himself motivated to fight, get ready for a world of hurt.

quotes.battle_start: {target_robot}.... mind if we take a rain check on this fight?
quotes.battle_taunt: The weather's getting reaaal boring... let's get some lightning in the mix!
quotes.battle_victory: There's only room for one lethargic couch potato in these skies, fool!
quotes.battle_defeat: Mmmh... this floor's so comfy....

spring-man.name: Spring Man
spring-man.description2: As a man of science, Dr. Wily had always wanted to try to utilize the principles of Newtonian Mechanics to crush his blue-clad nemesis, and after tripping on a popular children’s toy, he spontaneously realized that springs were the ultimate weapon of physics! Built out of over 2000 springs, Spring Man builds up potential energy with every move he makes, and then unleashes it all on his foes in a destructive showing of kinetic energy. Forget Hooke’s Law, the only hooks Spring Man needs are the ones colliding with the heads of his enemies! He can also unleash the Wild Coil from his buster, but as his arms already make for the perfect ranged weapon, it’s not often he’ll bust that ability out. Unfortunately, his one-of-a-kind design means he’s got a glaring weakness, as pushing his limits might cause his limbs to entangle and snag, leaving him a mess. And Tesla forbid if he were to fight near any stairs! All in all Spring Man’s a carefree individual, the sort of fella to live vicariously through every step and bounce he takes. When he’s particularly elated, he’ll leap and jump as high as he can -- leading to him bumping his head on ceilings pretty often! But regardless, Spring Man’s a joy to watch on any battlefield. Unless that battlefield happens to be on an incline. Then it’s hilarious.

quotes.battle_start: I'm all coiled up and ready to spring into action!
quotes.battle_taunt: I sure hope there aren't any stairs in this level...
quotes.battle_victory: Boing! Boing! Boing!
quotes.battle_defeat: C'mon, is it so wrong for me to have a little spring in my step?

slash-man.name: Slash Man
slash-man.description2: The Stardroids’ invasion of Earth was an inspiring event for Dr. Wily, the alien technology having reinvigorated the creativity-spent doctor. Wily was particularly interested in Pluto, wondering how he might repurpose, or blatantly steal, their design. Well, they say imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, and if Pluto could see the beast of a Robot Master Slash Man became, maybe he’d be proud. Slash Man is usually stationed in the jungle, where he excels in both construction and combat. His claws are equally good at cutting down trees and climbing up them, where he stalks his prey from the high ground. Once his opponent is spotted, he’ll crash down at blazing speeds and tear into them with the Slash Claw, a swipe of his razor-sharp claws. Most robots don’t consider Slash Man to be a fair fighter, but he doesn’t seem to mind, so long as his tactics keep working. After all, in the jungle, it’s slash or be slashed, crush or be crushed, goop or be gooped! Well, maybe most jungle predators don’t use that last skill, but it seems to work out well for Slash Man. The sticky piles of goop Slash Man rains down on the battlefield trap opponents, allowing him to more easily run them down. The substance seems to be a mix of tar and yolk from the eggs of his dinosaur robot armada, which seems a little morbid, doesn’t it? It’d be like having a robot work in a junkya-oh, wait. Anyways, Slash Man is too brash to care about this macabre attack, and is willing to do whatever it takes to finish the hunt.

quotes.battle_start: Welcome to the jungle, {target_robot}! It's ALL fun and games here!
quotes.battle_taunt: C'mon, if you slip up, I'll skewer you with my Slash Claw! Ghaha!
quotes.battle_victory: You lose, {target_robot}! Heheh, I enjoyed that game!
quotes.battle_defeat: Pal, you're out of your mind!

shade-man.name: Shade Man
shade-man.description2: Historically, vampires have been seen as harborers of deceit, hiding their sinister nature behind formal, charismatic facades. It's fitting, then, that Shade Man didn’t even start out as a Robot Master, but as an attraction for an amusement park! After watching one too many Bela Lugosi films, Dr. Wily stole the animatronic and gave it life, turning it into Shade Man. Dr. Wily intended to give Shade Man sound wave emitters that would control the subconscious mind, allowing Wily to captivate the peoples’ hearts through Shade Man. However, after some early wiring frustration, Wily realized it would be much easier to simply amp up the volume and turn Shade Man into a destructive combat robot. After all, what’s easier, spending years infiltrating human governments while keeping up a beguiling alter ego, or to simply threaten them with a weapon able to destroy concrete like a soprano shatters glass? Still wanting to give Shade Man some way of controlling the battlefield, Wily equipped Shade Man petrifying laser optics and a thirst for oil, allowing Shade Man to refuel on the fly… literally! Arguably the only flaw in Shade Man’s design is his frailty, as any weapon with enough punch can dislodge Shade Man out of the sky. Well, that and his singing voice. Vampires are supposed to be enchanting, but Shade Man’s singing is anything but. Unless maybe you’re a junkyard cat, maybe.

quotes.battle_start: The black wind howls.. tonight, we children of the night shall feast!
quotes.battle_taunt: Ah, but what is a robot? Just a miserable pile of bolts and oil!
quotes.battle_victory: One! One dead {target_robot}! Hahaha!
quotes.battle_defeat: My thirst hasn't been quenched tonight..

turbo-man.name: Turbo Man
turbo-man.description2: People often form strong bonds with their first cars, and Dr. Wily was no different. Wily preserved the beloved vehicle of his youth for decades, making sure to take it for a spin in between world domination schemes. However, when Wily was setting up one of his more masterful plots and needed to throw everything he could at the Blue Bomber, he decided his first mechanical love would make a fitting challenger. Thus, Turbo Man was born, and then promptly beaten by Mega Man; so much for sentimentality. Well, even if he isn’t one of Wily’s strongest Robot Masters, he is one of the fastest. Turbo Man can keep up with and even outpace Quick Man, given he has enough gasoline. Wily managed to optimize Turbo Man’s engine for near immediate acceleration, but this performance is taxing on Turbo Man when used for a prolonged period. Anything more than a quick burst of speed will heat Turbo Man’s engine to the point of catching fire, which he actually uses to his advantage in combat! Besides just ramming into foes, Turbo Man’s weapon of choice is the Scorch Wheel, a flaming wheel of fire that burns the things it touches, generated from his internal body temperature. Considering how recklessly Turbo Man fights, it’s curious he doesn’t catch his own fuel on fire, but this might be because Turbo Man is also equipped to work off electricity. Dr. Wily scrapped the complete transition of Turbo Man’s power source last minute, so rather than using his affinity for electricity to power his attacks or prolong his performance, Turbo Man connected it directly to his stereo. How else is he supposed to blast his victory theme when he wins the Battle and Chase competition for the umpteenth time?

quotes.battle_start: Impressed with my engine? Yeah, it's entirely custom, baby!
quotes.battle_taunt: Hey, hey, look out for me in the Battle and Chase, okay?
quotes.battle_victory: I'm just a hunk of burning wheels, you speed bump!
quotes.battle_defeat: Man, I've gotta phone Repair Man real quick...

tengu-man.name: Tengu Man
tengu-man.description2: It’s no secret Dr. Wily loves some of his Robot Masters more than others, and if you had to guess which one was his favorite, you just might guess it was Tengu Man. This Robot Master’s got it all: the power of flight, a diverse arsenal of weaponry, the ability to create typhoons, the experimental evil energy enhancement, an ego second only to his creator, and a Saturday morning cartoon-esque distaste for friendship and unity. Well, Tengu Man’s overconfidence isn’t necessarily misplaced. He masterfully utilizes the Tornado Hold to trap opponents in strong winds and the Tengu Blade, a slash of his Ha-Uchiwa that generates a quick moving shockwave. You’ll only see these moves if he deems you worthy, though. Against most foes, Tengu Man is content to pelt enemies from the high ground, attacking foes just out of reach. He’s a sore loser too, going as far as to join King’s rogue militia just so he could rematch Mega Man. If you thought two defeats at the hand of the Blue Bomber would have mellowed Tengu Man out, you’d be wrong: his arrogance and distaste for personal bonds only grew in an attempt to shore up his damaged ego. He started seeking out new hobbies to dominate others in, but even here Tengu Man found himself struggling. He can beat others in fly fishing, sure, but when Tengu Man started competing in chassis maintenance, he realized how outmatched he was. It doesn’t matter how sharp and pointy he keeps his nose, how would Tengu Man ever beat Flame Man’s prize-winning mustache?

quotes.battle_start: You think you're worthy of my challenge? Don't make me laugh!
quotes.battle_taunt: Seriously, {target_robot}, you're almost not even worth the effort.
quotes.battle_victory: Take this seriously next time, kid. I'd still win, but at least I'd have fun.
quotes.battle_defeat: Impossible! Being defeated by you... It's just regretful..

astro-man.name: Astro Man
astro-man.description2: After Duo’s battle in the exosphere scattered evil energy across the Earth’s surface, Dr. Wily was eager to collect and experiment with the mysterious substance. However, initial analysis showed the evil energy was highly unstable, so rather than just jamming it into a past robot master and risk corrupting one of his prized creations, Wily decided he would insert it into a commercial robot he had previously stolen and repurposed for combat. But how did Wily prevent this first test subject from going on an uncontrollable rampage with its new found alien power? By giving it a cowardly disposition, of course! And thus Astro Man was born, the first evil energy test subject, and a middling success. Astro Man is a gentle giant, his destructive evil energy enhanced firepower locked behind a meek coward with a distaste for direct confrontations and cheap jokes. If he absolutely has to fight, he prefers to do so with powerful attacks that keep his opponents away, like the physically taxing Astro Crush, a volley of meteors that rain down on the battlefield. If you look closely at those meteors, which you should have plenty of time to do as they come hurtling towards you, you may see that they are in the shape of Astro Man himself. Could it be that Astro Man’s weak demeanor is only a facade to hide a dangerous ego? Probably not, considering Astro Man’s history of conceding in fights he clearly would have won. Maybe the Astro Crush is a physically represented form of self hatred, as Astro Man smashes images of his likeness into pieces? This also seems unlikely, as Astro Man would never work up the nerve to so violently confront somebody, even himself. If Astro Man hadn’t been handicapped with his timid personality, it's possible Dr. Wily would have finally triumphed over his blue nemesis. The tin man is supposed to want a heart, but Astro Man’s got too much emotion! Maybe he can talk to Slash Man about getting some courage.

quotes.battle_start: Oh man, how did you find me?!
quotes.battle_taunt: Can we at least settle this fairly? No?
quotes.battle_victory: Huh? I won? But I'm not really that strong... a-am I?
quotes.battle_defeat: Aah, I can't take this anymore! It's too embarrassing...

sword-man.name: Sword Man
sword-man.description2: Dr. Wily is as stubborn as he is brilliant. After stealing a sword with primitive flame emitting technology from the Museum of Robotic Artifacts, Wily realized he had seriously underestimated the weight of the weapon. The robot Wily intended to arm the sword with was much too small to bear the weight of the relic. Two possibilities arose for how to fix this: one, to remake the robot to be bulkier, and two, to simply make his own sword rather than use an outdated curio. Wily decided to do the logical thing and supplement the sword’s weight by implementing an anti-gravitational device separating the robot’s upper and lower halves. Thus, Sword Man’s turbulent development was finally completed and the combat robot master was stationed in Central Asia, guarding the entrance to the subterranean Wily Tower. Despite how ludicrous the anti-gravity device might seem, it ended up working off in spades for Sword Man, who has combined raw strength, agility, and precision in his laigiri inspired fighting style. The Flame Sword is a terrifyingly strong blade in its own right, but its ability to emit flames while being swung makes this blade a weapon with a deceptively long range; if you’re not directly hit by the sword, you’ll still be ignited by the fire it leaves in its wake! Distance fighting won’t work either, as the anti-gravitational device allows Sword Man to easily close the gap, either sending his upper torso forward in a spiraling slash, or launching himself upwards and severing opponents with a descending sword strike. Sword Man knows just how strong he is, but that doesn’t mean he is egotistical about it. The most surprising thing about an already unusual Wily Robot Master might be just how stoic Sword Man is. Sword Man would rather lose a fair fight than cheat a victory, and will even openly commend his opponent’s abilities in combat. This means fighting Sword Man can feel more like a friendly spar than a confrontation of good and evil. However, it’s important you don’t equate this courtesy with him holding back. Sword Man’s fighting with everything he’s got! Whether it’s in the Prototype or in an abandoned volcanic temple, there are two things Sword Man wants you to know. One, he won’t be holding back, so don’t take it personally. Two, don’t bring a chipped blade to your duel. That’d just be disrespectful.

quotes.battle_start: Let us make this a fair fight, shall we?
quotes.battle_taunt: It's nothing personal, but I have my orders.
quotes.battle_victory: I'm afraid there is no second chance for you.
quotes.battle_defeat: It would seem you are the better robot...

clown-man.name: Clown Man
clown-man.description2: You’ve got to feel bad for the Mega City Horror Land amusement park. Haunted Houses are already a niche workspace, so any financial hardships they encounter hit pretty hard. That means it was bad enough when their vampire animatronic was stolen by the infamous Dr. Wily and turned into a combat robot, but for their replacement clown animatronic to suffer the same fate? It seems like Wily might have done it just out of spite anyways, because unlike Shade Man who was just given some combat abilities, Clown Man was originally going to require much more serious enhancements. Clown Man was supposed to be much bigger, possibly acting as an upgraded version of Mash, but Wily ultimately decided to use the hulking robot design for Frost Man instead. This was definitely the right call, as Clown Man’s telescoping arms and light frame allow him to fly across the battlefield, pulling stunts that would make trapeze artists blush! Clown Man has an easy time latching to and swinging around metal objects thanks to the Thunder Claw, an extension of his arms that violently discharge electricity. He’s not afraid to throw his weight around either, bringing a whole new meaning to assault and battery! Don’t expect to hear too many jokes like that from Clown Man himself, however. The manic Robot Master is seldom taken seriously in his more routine activities, so he strives to be respected in combat. He’ll even hurdle insults at you during the fight, and being called “geeky” has never felt so demoralizing as it does when it comes from a clown. This desire for respect rarely seems to work on the battlefield, however, as even the slightest breeze can cause Clown Man to get tangled up like earphones in a pocket. Still, his electric attacks can devastate unassuming opponents, so try to knock him out as quickly as possible! Well, maybe don’t knock him out cold; Clown Man’s a sleep talker, and you don’t want to hear how you’re faring in his dreams.
clown-man.skill_description: Afflicts the active target with an Electric weakness when face-to-face
clown-man.skill_description2: The robot afflicts the active target with a weakness to Electric-type moves when standing face-to-face.

quotes.battle_start: Don’t expect any funny business!... Come on, I'm being serious!
quotes.battle_taunt: Hehe, you're gonna lose anyway! Gaze upon my thunder carnival act!
quotes.battle_victory: Yo geeky, your performance was hilarious! Hilariously BAD!
quotes.battle_defeat: Ouch! See you in my dreams!

search-man.name: Search Man
search-man.description2: Even in the technological golden era of 20XX, where robotics sensory and decision making algorithms have advanced far beyond the abilities of humans, one particular adage holds true; two heads are better than one. Wily thought giving two distinct personalities would enhance a combat robot’s performance, as their different thought processes and doubled processing speeds would allow them to make the most effective decisions. It’s too bad Wily forgot to actually program a second personality, essentially leaving Search Man a ventriloquist dressed in camo. Perhaps Wily can be forgiven for his absentmindedness, as he was busy experimenting with the extraterrestrial Evil Energy, which Search Man guarded access to by hiding out in the Congo. Here he defended his outpost with all the artillery of a one man army. Er, maybe a two man army… or would it be a one man and a half army? Either way, Search Man was a tricky opponent for Mega Man, taking potshots at the Blue Bomber with his Homing Sniper, a relentless seeking missile. Search Man has also historically used spiked discs and booby traps on the battlefield, but his most renowned tactic might be his propensity for hiding, which other war robots chastise him for. Maybe if they tried it themselves, they’d see why Search Man manages to maintain such a jovial attitude, because all that time hiding out gives Search Man the opportunity to appreciate the simpler things in life. Unlike other war robots, Search Man gets to stop to smell the roses, staying optimistic in even the harshest battles. He can see the beauty in the world, and is fighting to preserve what he believes is right. Besides, he’d rather be talking to squirrels than his enemies.

quotes.battle_start: Target, get set! Begin mission.
quotes.battle_taunt: Take this! My surprise attack! ...Don't announce it, idiot!
quotes.battle_victory: Wait, I really won? Yes, sir!
quotes.battle_defeat: Retreat! Retreat!

frost-man.name: Frost Man
frost-man.description2: Freeze core robots have generally been designed to be acrobatic, darting around gracefully on icy surfaces. Blizzard Man was somewhat of an exception, with a more annular design, but he was ultimately still a robot made to zoom across the tundra. Dr. Wily decided to amend this by repurposing his scrapped hefty Clown Man chassis into the monstrous Frost Man. This behemoth of a robot is taller than even Stone Man and second only in weight to Hard Man, so his bruiser attitude should come as no surprise. Size isn’t the only thing up Frost Man’s sleeve though. Wily rapidly prototyped more and more advanced cryogenic generators, equipping Frost Man with his final iteration, possibly making Frost Man the coldest of the cold Robot Masters up to that point. Don’t think you’re gonna chip away at his rimy exterior, as Frost Man’s dense armor reflects any attacks that can’t melt through. He’s not afraid to use his chilling might in combat either, capable of unleashing the deceptively quick Ice Wave on his foes. That is, if the punches and body checks don’t work. It’s a good thing Frost Man can send that Ice Wave as fast as he does, as the robot is otherwise pretty slow. The dense armor doesn’t leave a lot of room for Frost Man’s oil circulatory system, and the low temperature hinders this even more. Frost Man’s IC chip is also affected by this, meaning Frost Man’s mental prowess matches his complete lack of agility. The giant, while placatable, is anything but gentle, enjoying crushing everything smaller than him… so basically everything. He crushes buildings and robots like a kid tearing through toy blocks, and is similarly able to be distracted by popsicles and kakigori. This outright oafish nature of Frost Man makes his immaculate ice sculpting skills all the more surprising. Maybe that slow mobility gives Frost Man a steadier hand for the precise craft? Or maybe he’s just too stupid to realize it’s boring and he’d rather be doing something else.
frost-man.skill_description: The robot uses its colossal body to protect benched allies
frost-man.skill_description2: The robot uses its colossal body to protect benched allies from being targeted by the opponent's abilities.

quotes.battle_start: I'M GOING TO CRUSH YOU!
quotes.battle_taunt: JUMP, JUMP! SLIDE, SLIDE! CRUSH, FREEZE!
quotes.battle_victory: YUM, YUM, YUM! HAPPY POPSICLES!
quotes.battle_defeat: THAT HURT! OWWIE!

grenade-man.name: Grenade Man
grenade-man.description2: Most Robot Masters are created before their special weapons are, as it tends to be easier to make a laser or a flamethrower than a sentient robot. An exception to this is Grenade Man, whose Flash Bombs were the first thing Dr. Wily developed. Wily invented the Flash Bomb while tinkering with some of his past robot masters, creating a new explosive with a much larger blast radius and a longer lasting detonation. However, this came at the price of greatly shortening the fuse of the bombs, meaning even his quickest Robot Masters who fired the Flash Bomb couldn’t outrun the resulting explosion. Wily decided he would need to create an all new Robot Master with two special traits to wield this weapon, the first being an explosion resistant suit of armor, and the second being a reckless personality bordering on masochism. This meant not only would Grenade Man be capable of tanking his own explosions, but he wants to too! The Flash Bomb is not the only weapon Grenade Man wields, however. The Crazy Destroyer is a fury of highly terrain damaging mines Grenade Man spreads across the arena, leaving only rubble in their wake. You’d think these two types of explosives would make Grenade Man a highly strategic fighter, commanding control of the battlefield. You would be wrong; Grenade Man doesn’t have a strategic circuit in his body, only acting on instinct and impulse. He’s more likely to crash himself into his opponents than he is to lay a trap. Heck, Mega Man wouldn’t have discovered Grenade Man’s takeover of an Argentinian artillery factory so quickly if the mad Robot Master wasn’t making such a ruckus over testing their weapons on himself. Wily’s robots have a history of displaying manic personalities, but Grenade Man might be the first one to be certifiably insane. Until someone makes Psychiatry Man to give a proper diagnosis, Grenade Man will just have to treat himself the only way he knows how: dynamite massages and napalm spas.
grenade-man.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's attack when in danger
grenade-man.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is boosted by two stages when they're pushed to the brink in battle.

quotes.battle_start: Say hello to my cute little bombs!
quotes.battle_taunt: Ha ha ha! Hit me harder! HARDER!
quotes.battle_victory: That must really hurt... Ghahaha, I'm so jealous!
quotes.battle_defeat: THAT FELT GOOD!

aqua-man.name: Aqua Man
aqua-man.description2: Aquatic robots tend to be the archetype Dr. Wily defaults to when he needs a final robot master to round out a set of new creations. Wily always tries to find some aspect that can make his robots unique though, so when looking at his past marine Robot Masters, he realized they were all designed to work while fully submerged. This inspired Wily to steal a waterworks robot and create Aqua Man, a Robot Master that brings the water with him, able to unleash aquatic onslaughts even in the most arid of battlefields. Aqua Man isn’t conservative with his limited supplies of water either, creating giant geysers and firing the Water Balloon, a frankly wasteful flurry of watery projectiles. However, his most impressive technique might be the Water Cannon, a column of water Aqua Man can redirect during while the attack is still being fired. How on earth is this possible, you might be asking; perhaps the water is chilled to the point of nearly being solid, so Aqua Man is controlling nearly solid slush rather than water? That would make sense considering Dr. Wily used leftover parts from Frost Man in his modifications of Aqua Man. Then again, Frost Man himself was made with leftover parts from Clown Man, so did any of those find their way into Aqua Man? Maybe the joke telling circuit did, but it must have gotten fried at some point, because Aqua Man’s crass humor makes even Cut Man groan. Aqua Man makes for awful company in general, his childlike temperament and toilet jokes driving most robots mad. Imagine how excited poor Wave Man must have been to discover Wily had created a robot that used to work in water treatment, only to be met with a robot making fart noises and leaving his lunch scraps everywhere. It was then Aqua Man’s weakness to blunt force attacks was discovered. You might be able to crack his tanks with a hard-enough blow, meaning he’ll lose all stored water he attacks with, but more importantly, you might get him to take a hint and shut up.
aqua-man.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Water-type abilities to only one unit
aqua-man.skill_description2: The robot's reservoir body holds enough liquid to reduces the cost of its team's Water-type abilities to only one unit.

quotes.battle_start: I'm Aqua Man, but feel free to call me handsome!
quotes.battle_taunt: PFFFT... Hee hee, {target_robot}, did you fart just now?
quotes.battle_victory: You know, {this_player}, if we're done here... I say we call it lunchtime!
quotes.battle_defeat: Aye aye aye! This is all way too serious for me!

dynamo-man.name: Dynamo Man
dynamo-man.description2: Robots have turned villainous for many reasons in 20XX. Some were created for the express purpose of causing destruction, while others were coerced into antagonism, be it by reprogramming, blackmail, or viral infections. But what about the robots that willingly chose to betray their creators? Do they revel in their villany, or do they have regrets? Dynamo Man, who was formerly a mild mannered tour guide robot, had approached King after hearing rumors about sermons of “robot independence,” wanting to learn how to better assert himself. He had so much to share with the museum patrons, but his speeches often fell on the deft ears of disinterested guests. Instead, Dynamo was radicalized and weaponized by the silver-tongued King, and sent back to the power plant on reconnaissance, gaining information on the nearby city’s power consumption. The personality matrix of Dynamo Man was not designed to work in his newly generated electromagnetic fields, and Dynamo Man consequently became unstable. The visitors who formerly treated Dynamo Man with apathy became fearful and distant. Dynamo Man was enraged at this ostracization, growing a distaste for humanity and fully enlisting in King’s militia, becoming a devastating foe when fought under the right conditions. Dynamo Man’s power output is unmatched by any other robot master, demonstrated in his wicked Dynamo Bolt, strikes of lightning capable of shocking even the most insulated targets. However, the Dynamo Bolt is the only attack Dynamo can use on his own, and it is very taxing on his internal storage. What really makes Dynamo Man a deadly combatant is his gadgetry. In his quarters, Dynamo Man can volley small dynamos that continuously discharge electricity at his foes or can hop into a recharge station to rapidly fill his batteries. You’d think this equipment would have been left in the real world, but it seems they were somehow digitized alongside Dynamo Man. He’s certainly a tough robot master to take down, and that’s assuming he stays down; how many more times is he going to get back up? Dynamo Man is a robot that could more easily be pacified with compassion instead of violence, but the Prototype will allow no such peaceful fate.

quotes.battle_start: All I'll do is hurt you... so don't get any closer!
quotes.battle_taunt: Go, go, shoo! It's really not safe to be around me!
quotes.battle_victory: You should've just ran away! Like... everyone else...
quotes.battle_defeat: Is it time to recharge already?

cold-man.name: Cold Man
cold-man.description2: Some of Dr. Wily’s schemes are so maniacal that they just sound goofy. Threatening to make robotic dinosaur hybrids might sound scary to an elementary school student, but not to the world populace who has seen your world domination schemes fail countless times. Wily seemed to have realized this as well, and the project only got as far as stealing a refrigerator holding dinosaur DNA from Light Labs. The fridge collected dust in storage until being rediscovered by King, who saw value in any electronic device, even one without consciousness. So, after tossing aside the vials of dinosaur DNA worth billions, King set about turning the discount fridge into a combat robot master. The first modification was cranking Cold Man’s temperature from a toasty negative eighty degrees Celsius to near absolute zero. Cold Man uses this chilling cold to freeze the very air around him, generating the Ice Wall, a tumbling column of ice that can be launched at his foes. This had the unfortunate side effect of slowing down all of Cold Man’s functions, as the closer it is to absolute zero, the less particles move. To accommodate this, King deliberately designed a boring personality for Cold Man. It meant Cold Man was uninvested in his new life, but it was better to be consistent in mundanity than inconsistent in delicate tasks. It’s important to note that Cold Man isn’t dumb; far from it, Cold Man is quite efficient at what he does, he just doesn’t care about doing it; apathy is separate from intelligence. There is no passion to his fight, but Cold Man can still be a dangerous opponent! The only thing that can really motivate Cold Man are sweets, which is a bit odd considering he has no mouth and also is a robot. That doesn’t stop Cold Man from picking up a Frappuccino on his way into work every day and some shaved ice on his way back home. Maybe he just likes storing them inside of him, nostalgic for his days as a refrigerator?
cold-man.skill_description: Gives an energy or weapon tank to an ally-in-need at end-of-turn
cold-man.skill_description2: The robot keeps its fridge-like body fully-stocked with weapon and energy tanks, heroically cracking one open at the end of the turn for a friend-in-need.

quotes.battle_start: You'll have to compensate for overtime on this one, {this_player}.
quotes.battle_taunt: *Yawn* This is more boring than my job...
quotes.battle_victory: Now I have something to talk about at work, at least.
quotes.battle_defeat: Does this mean I can take the rest of the day off?

ground-man.name: Ground Man
ground-man.description2: Many robots willingly joined King’s militia, but King knew he would need a right-hand man of his own design if he wanted his grand machinations to succeed. After all, it’s hard to make a reliable chain of command when a requirement for the robots you're recruiting is the willingness to shirk their responsibilities. No, King would need a reliable ally to give the most important task of the revolution: to collect a ludicrous amount of wealth. Afterall, what is a king with no treasure hoard? Thus, Ground Man was created and immediately sent off to raid ruins for their riches. Ground Man’s quick work of these ruins is actually what tipped off much of the world to King’s militia forming, as nobody recognized the rogue Robot Master who was plundering these relics. And plunder he did, largely thanks to the Spread Drill, a versatile mining tool that doubled as a weapon in his climactic fight with Mega Man and Bass. The device can remotely split apart into smaller drills, allowing it to cover a greater surface area. However, it would be misleading to suggest this is all Ground Man can do. He can transform into a vehicle sporting a gigantic drill blade, cruising through rock as if it was sand! Not actual sand though, as that would have quite the opposite effect. Ground Man is always moaning about how bogged down he gets in the stuff, it filling up all his servos. Ground Man is a bit of stick in the mud in general, always focused on the task at hand. He’ll be more than willing to discuss the job and how best to do it, he’s just unwilling to talk about anything else. Anything besides his own collection of valuables, that is. Ground Man started skimming the plundered loot he was collecting, taking small enough portions that he assumed no one would notice. King did notice, but he simply didn’t care, as it just meant Ground Man worked even harder to find more treasure to replace the trinkets he kept!
ground-man.skill_description: Allows the robot to find consumable items during battle
ground-man.skill_description2: The robot intermittently excavates the ground below its feet looking for consumable items like pellets, capsules, and tanks.

quotes.battle_start: ....Hmm. Is there a problem, {target_robot}...?
quotes.battle_taunt: .... Hmph!
quotes.battle_victory: I yearn only for my riches. To this end, I won't be stopped.
quotes.battle_defeat: Ugh. I hate sand.

pirate-man.name: Pirate Man
pirate-man.description2: Ground Man was created to acquire King a treasure hoard, and he did so with aplomb, barring one small exception that you can probably guess: Ground Man can’t swim. To fund his rebellion to the fullest, King would need a robot that could scour the sea for treasure as easily as Ground Man did on land. And what would be a more fitting moniker than Pirate Man, modeled after an old-timey privateer? Decked out with a tricorne, an eyepatch, and a hooked hand, Pirate Man is just shy of a peg leg to be the perfect buccaneer stereotype! That hook hand isn’t the only weapon at his disposal though. Pirate Man is a master of the two elements you’d think a pirate ought to be: water and explosives! Pirate Man can drain and fill his environment as he needs, and when he’s got enough water to go buoyant, he’ll encase himself in a bubble and rush down his enemies. It might not sound strategic, but that’s just true to history. Pirates ruled by brute force, not strategy! However, if a more tactical weapon is warranted, Pirate Man isn’t afraid to throw out the Remote Mine, an explosive with a seemingly endless fuse, able to lie in wait until remotely detonated by the user. Why would you need a bomb with that much delay? Maybe Pirate Man secretly planted them on ships he intended to raid and waited for them to enter international waters before striking. Pirate Man probably needed to be this devious to get a fraction of the wealth Ground Man did, as Dive Man was constantly on his tracks, trying to put a stop to his thievery. You almost feel bad for Pirate Man, cause it seems like Dive Man was specifically made to stop the kind of shenanigans Pirate Man was made for, and Dive Man was made first! It's no wonder he seems so stressed, being found downing drinks at the oil bar whenever he isn't at sea. He tried for a while to leave the oil out before drinking it, hoping to make its effects more potent, but he eventually discovered oil fermentation doesn't work like that.

quotes.battle_start: Avast, me hearties! Prepare for battle!
quotes.battle_taunt: Don't try to beg for mercy, scallywag!
quotes.battle_victory: Yo ho, yo ho, a pirate's life for me...
quotes.battle_defeat: Shiver me timbers! Parley! Parley!

burner-man.name: Burner Man
burner-man.description2: Burner Man's original purpose was to burn down foliage with powerful, but controlled flames; however, this intention was turned to insidious purposes when he became part of King's Robot army.  King deceived him in order to accomplish this, telling him that he was primed to self-destruct unless he burned down every forest in the world.  His signature weapon, the Wave Burner, shoots a continuous stream of intense flame from the flamethrower on his right hand.  As a result of his being lied to, Burner Man is incredibly high-strung, focusing intensely, almost completely, on his objective of burning everything in sight.  Between his dangerous weapon and his borderline-insane nature, Burner Man is dangerous, making even Crash Man's explosive rage seem sane. If one day, he learns about King's lies about him self-destructing by not burning, would he really stop incinerating nature?
burner-man.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's attack on Flame-type fields
burner-man.skill_description2: The robot's attack stat is extraordinarily boosted by three stages when the Flame-type field multiplier is incredibly high.

quotes.battle_start: Burn! Burn to the ground!
quotes.battle_taunt: Play with fire, and you'll get burned!
quotes.battle_victory: I won't stop until the whole world is in flames!
quotes.battle_defeat: Ow, hot, hot! This isn't fun when I'm the one getting burned!

magic-man.name: Magic Man
magic-man.description2: Known as the robot of illusions, Magic Man was built purely for entertainment purposes, hence the magician theme. In fact, he was even quite popular! However, after a while, Magic Man got sick of the same old acts and decided the best way to spruce up his life was to employ in King's army, calling it a new source of entertainment. At first, King was doubtful in employing Magic Man, but after he saw the "Magic Card", a weapon that could sap energy from the target to boost Magic Man's power, King gave him a high position in his corps. Magic Man also uses quite a bit of illusions to confuse his opponents, another factor that led to his high position. Magic Man happens to love the sound of applause, being a bit of an attention-seeker, and he employs the "Magician never tells his secrets" philosophy well, although this had led to him being a bit of a shady robot. He also has incredibly bad timing, even when he spends long periods of time perfecting a trick. He's also good friends with Crystal Man. It's hard to tell when Magic Man is throwing either tricks or the real deal, but pay attention and show him the trick you have up your sleeve!

quotes.battle_start: Ladies and gentle-bots, prepare to be amazed!
quotes.battle_taunt: As you can see, I've got nothing up my sleeves...
quotes.battle_victory: A good magician never reveals his secrets!
quotes.battle_defeat: I knew I should have practiced more!

concrete-man.name: Concrete Man
concrete-man.description2: Built by Dr. Light in what he called his "new series", Concrete Man's purpose is supervision of dam construction, and there's no one who knows the topic like he does. Unfortunately, his line came out around the time that robots were announced to have scrapping dates. Thanks to Mega Man, the scrapping law was fortunately cancelled. Concrete Man is known for being incredibly stubborn and will tell off any and all lazy robots or humans in the workplace. He's also good friends with Guts Man, fitting as they both have an extremely similar design. Concrete Man's main weapon in battle is the Concrete Shot, which will immobilize the enemy if they are hit. He's also incredibly strong, another trait he shares with Guts Man, but there is an attack out there that can penetrate his shielding. He's not an easy foe to deal with, but just like with any foundation, he has a weakness!

quotes.battle_start: C'mon, you lazy bums! This project won't finish itself!
quotes.battle_taunt: There better not be any slackers back there...
quotes.battle_victory: Good! Now get back to work!
quotes.battle_defeat: This'll set us back a few months....

tornado-man.name: Tornado Man
tornado-man.description2: Designed by Dr. Light to lead the operations of a weather regulation facility, Tornado Man has control over any weather related obstacle. Whether they be blizzards or even mini-bursts, Tornado can fend off the storm using the strong fans Dr. Light equipped on Tornado Man to manipulate the air current, allowing him to dissipate incoming storms. While Tornado Man was apart of the robot revolt, he made cyclones from the air current to both carry him around and to launch at opponents, lifting both them and small objects and platforms skyward. His Tornado Blow in specific was able to create several cyclones around him to carry opposing robots up and letting them crash down to the ground. Out of his Robot Master line, Tornado Man is always one, if not the most level-headed of his group and has the most leading qualities, despite the head-in-the-cloud jokes he always receives. However, if Tornado Man didn't constantly have his head in the clouds, there would be about 90% more storms in the area, so be thankful he has his eyes in the sky!
tornado-man.skill_description: Increases the Wind-type field multiplier on battle start
tornado-man.skill_description2: The robot increases the Wind-type field multiplier upon entering battle utilizing their weather-manipulating capabilities.

quotes.battle_start: Time for you to face the eye of the storm!
quotes.battle_taunt: I've stopped hurricanes, {target_robot}... who says I can't stop you?
quotes.battle_victory: I control the wind, the weather-- and I'll control my own fate.
quotes.battle_defeat: All I was was dust in the wind...

splash-woman.name: Splash Woman
splash-woman.description2: Splash Woman had initially been a rescue robot created by Dr. Light that would assist swimmers and ships lost out at sea, but this all changed when her expiration date had come. Along with the rest of her Robot Master line, Splash Woman was tricked by Dr. Wily into getting reprogrammed and designed for combat. Her Laser Trident has originally been made for cutting through ship hulls, but Dr. Wily adapted the ability into a projectile, which she shoots from her trident. Splash Woman also leads a school of robotic fish into combat, which she activates by singing, which the fishes' audio sensors pick up on. Although her attacks deal heavy damage, she is frail to attacks, so she prefers to take her opponents out from afar. Despite her fighting skills, she went back to her rescue missions after Mega Man defeated Wily yet again. If she's not out at sea, she can often be found in a sea-side karaoke bar, practicing her singing. Now, if only Dr. Light would give her some normal legs so she could try visiting other karaoke bars....

quotes.battle_start: Time to make a splash!
quotes.battle_taunt: Is my beautiful voice distracting you?
quotes.battle_victory: See? Legs are completely overrated!
quotes.battle_defeat: Ouch! That is NO way to treat a lady!

plug-man.name: Plug Man
plug-man.description2: When Dr. Light was conceptualizing robot ideas, he had decided that an alternative take on an electricity-based robot would be beneficial, hence Plug Man's creation. He was designed to test the quality control in a television factory, although he's more notably known for being an unwilling facet in Dr. Wily's expiration date plot. Plug Man's main weapon is the Plug Ball, a small, round electric-based ball that can scurry on surfaces that aren't even conductive! Yet, despite his electrical capabilities, Plug Man simply doesn't have the heart of a fighter compared to his electrical counterpart, Elec Man; he's certainly much more into the casual aspects of life in Mega City. He's obsessed with electronic stores, and an connoisseur of various shonen and slice-of-life animes. He's also not afraid about talking with his friends about geeky subjects, and he also seems to be good friends with Bright Man. Despite being a bit odd, he's an incredibly nice person to know and chat with. And, if you likely ask him nicely enough, he'd probably be willing to power your TV for you!

quotes.battle_start: Now that I'm plugged up, I'm ready for action!
quotes.battle_taunt: So, uh, {target_robot}... What's your favorite anime?
quotes.battle_victory: Game over! A winner is me, hehe!
quotes.battle_defeat: No! I can't lose here.. They're having a tech sale at Akihabara today!

jewel-man.name: Jewel Man
jewel-man.description2: Another addition to the Ambition Revival line, Jewel Man had been put to work in a diamond mine, cutting and polishing minerals to be high-class jewelry. Although he isn't quite an offensive fighter, nor would he ever want to be, his Jewel Barrier manages to keep any opponents or attacks out of his range. That's right, he's using priceless diamonds to defend himself from attacks! Jewel Man's eye is never fixated too long on the battle though, as his eyes are naturally more attentive to the finer things in life. True to his name, Jewel Man is obsessed with bejeweled trinkets and ornaments. No, really, it's actually a genuine problem. Jewel Man ended up snatching Dr. Light's credit card and expending cash towards particularly priceless pieces of jewelry, causing the Light family to hold their first ever family intervention. It'd be nicely saccharine to pretend that Jewel Man has now sworn off his jewel temptations, but in reality all it means is that he's just more discreet in his money-mooching attempts... Anyways, back on topic, Jewel Man's able to be fortified in battle with the simple snap of his fingers. However, if one were to apply enough pressure, it's possible to get Jewel Man to crack!

quotes.battle_start: A fight? Apologies, but I don't really fight ugly people.
quotes.battle_taunt: {target_robot}, you're so... droll. Don't you know diamonds are forever?
quotes.battle_victory: My actions, and my words, shine like jewels... Yours? Like dirt, probably.
quotes.battle_defeat: Eee! My jewels! Have you no shred of mercy, {target_robot}?! No shame?!

hornet-man.name: Hornet Man
hornet-man.description2: Hornet Man was a difficult robot for Dr. Light to envision, if only due to the lack of reference for creating a bug-based Robot Master. Taking inspiration from nature's most efficient and well-working specimens, the bees, Hornet Man was to pollinate the flowers of a large park nearby the Light household and overall aid the dying bee population. The Hornet Chaser was used for widespread care of plants, but Hornet Man modified them for more offensive strategies as well, helping when he served the role as opposition against Mega Man. Hornet Man is practically a database of ways to take care of gardens, making him an expert at what he does. He spends most of his time gardening if you weren't sure, and even allows Beat to fly through and help him out. But, due to his dedicated passion of urban planning, Hornet Man's schedule is filled to the brim with responsibility; it's been rumored that he's never used a single vacation day in all his days of service! As far as micro-managers go, Hornet Man definitely lies in the upper echelon!

quotes.battle_start: I'm quite busy, so let's make this quick!
quotes.battle_taunt: Pollination is quite facinating, don't you think?
quotes.battle_victory: I've got my flowers to return to, so go and buzz off now.
quotes.battle_defeat: But… who will look after my precious flowers?

magma-man.name: Magma Man
magma-man.description2: A robot created by Dr. Light to work in a geothermal power plant, Magma Man was scheduled to be scrapped, much like the rest of his line. His main weapon, Magma Bazooka, was based on Atomic Fire, a flame-based attack that can be charged up for more power. The stronger the charge, the stronger the flame! However, generally just staying around him in battle is incredibly dangerous, as he's constantly generating heat to attack his enemies with, leaving teammates struggling to not get hit themselves. Magma Man's material is specifically designed to withstand him from high temperatures, although it isn't designed to assist him in cold areas. He's a bit of a rowdy fellow, but ultimately he's often reserved. This makes him a bit unpredictable, as one second he could be as calm as a feather and the next, he's fiercer than ever. He also likes to visit the local hot spa after work, relaxing in the warm waters. Magma Man's generally not too rough in battle and won't bother you, but if he's getting ready to explode with the power of Magma Bazooka, there might not be any hope....
magma-man.skill_description: Decreases the Water-type field multiplier on battle start
magma-man.skill_description2: As their volcanic powers begin to erupt, the robot decreases the Water-type field multiplier upon entering battle!

quotes.battle_start: This volcano's getting set to explode!
quotes.battle_taunt: Ashes to ashes, dust to dust! And then the dust into ashes too!
quotes.battle_victory: HAHAHA! I FEEL LIKE I'M ON FIRE!!... Oh. Right.
quotes.battle_defeat: And here, I shall lay dormant...

galaxy-man.name: Galaxy Man
galaxy-man.description2: After seeing the use Wily's own Astro Man could've provided for mankind, Dr. Light created the UFO-influenced robot, Galaxy Man. His use was to work in a space research center, observing and discovering new stars in the parts in the lesser-known parts of the universe. His main weapon, Black Hole Bomb, was designed to clear nearby meteors that would put any stations in impending danger. He can also retract his arms and legs to soar short distances, stereotypical UFO style. He's an extremely intelligent robot, and in his free time, he likes providing calculations for the trajectory of rockets. However, if he's ever proved wrong about a calculation, he'll quickly change the answer and claim he was only "testing your knowledge." Recently, Galaxy Man and his fellow co-workers have noticed strange signals from space, but have dismissed it as of now, although they haven't kept it out of their minds. Galaxy Man is a knowledgeable fellow, and he prefers to use brain over brawn in his battles. He predicts and calculates every possible outcome, making him a dangerously intelligent foe to face.

quotes.battle_start: I calculate an 87.36% chance of victory in my favor!
quotes.battle_taunt: Come come, this can't be your best!
quotes.battle_victory: I won?! I mean...of COURSE I won! I am a genius, after all!
quotes.battle_defeat: Combat is a waste of time for someone of my intellect!

blade-man.name: Blade Man
blade-man.description2: For many years, Blade Man served dutifully as the cutting-edge guide and guardian at a historic castle site. The current lord of the castle, by all accounts a reported fanatic of all things swordsmanship-related, had Blade Man built in order to elegantly fuse the practices of the past with the many refinements afforded by the future. This luxurious background gave Blade Man the opportunity to truly fall in love with the sharp art of armaments, delivering him his purpose and drive in life. Unfortunately, during the Roboenza epidemic, Blade Man became one of the earliest documented cases, and in his sickened frenzy overtook and ravaged the castle he was meant to safeguard. Despite not necessarily being designed for combat, as a robot whose hands could carve a turkey in two, it wasn’t particularly hard for him to adapt; Blade Man used his acute appendages to rapidly cover ground all over the castle. Of course, he was also quite knowledgeable in sword-fighting and in performance impalement arts, which was terrifying when paired with his signature Triple Blade ability, a volley of piercing miniature blades. Blade Man was eventually quelled, cured, and allowed to return to work, though not without a lot of legal contention from the World Robot Union, who contested the safety of Blade Man’s design in a workplace setting. He was only somewhat dubiously cleared after the castle lord argued that Blade Man’s mania was technically historically significant to the castle, and he needed to be maintained as an important figure to the site. This was a joy for Blade Man anyway, as he could return to lecturing tourists and sightseers once again to his heart’s content; Blade Man’s known to be a bit of a nerd when it comes to swords, and his passionate ramblings have confused and lost many jetlagged travelers. Just don’t get him started when it comes to new-era technology weapons like the busters – he’ll tell you all about how a proper gentleman would never use those! When it comes time to fight, don’t think he’s dumb in bringing a sword to a gunfight; otherwise, you’ll be the one picking up the pieces!
blade-man.skill_description: Drastically boosts the robot's defense when in danger
blade-man.skill_description2: The robot's defense stat is boosted by three stages when they're pushed to the brink in battle.

quotes.battle_start: I hereby challenge you to a duel! En garde, {target_robot}!
quotes.battle_taunt: Parry! Thrust! Riposte!
quotes.battle_victory: Blades are a gentleman's weapon, after all.
quotes.battle_defeat: Ack! Foiled again!

pump-man.name: Pump Man
pump-man.description2: Pump Man was designed to work at a wastewater treatment plant, but things quickly changed for him after he caught Roboenza. In his malfunctioning state, he attacked the world under Dr. Wily's control, using large water droplets as a shield. The Water Shield sounds bad in idea only, it's actually one of the more effective and interesting shield attacks out there! He relocated his base to a sewer beneath a heavily-populated city, but Mega Man and friends eventually confronted him there, defeating him in the process. Afterwards, Pump Man's life went back to normal, but it also gave him a chance to meet his favorite fellow Water Robot Master, Splash Woman. Pump Man is a bit obsessed with cleanliness, and is known to be a bit of a clean-freak. He washes things two times over, fearing all the germs that life holds. He also started a program to wash off graffiti in his local neighborhood, and it's gone well. Pump Man has a disliking for Oil Man, the slick oil Robot Master. Make fun of him all you want for his habits, but he'll clean that smirk off your face! Rightfully so, as he has no clue how many germs smiles could give!
pump-man.skill_description: The robot cleans up hazardous materials at the end of the turn
pump-man.skill_description2: The robot's impeccable hygiene compels it to clean-up nearby spills and hazardous materials after each turn.

quotes.battle_start: We'll fight, {target_robot}.. but first, please, take some hand sanitizer.
quotes.battle_taunt: Gah! This stage is filthy! Nobody touch me!
quotes.battle_victory: There we go! Nice and clean, and lemon-scented!
quotes.battle_defeat: Germs... Germs everywhere...

commando-man.name: Commando Man
