commando-man.description2: Commando Man was a robot specifically designed for intense weather, who used remote detonation techniques to clear various minefields all throughout the world. His main technique was the Commando Bomb, a small missile with quite an impact range, that can turn in sharp 90 degree angles. His armor was also intended to handle strong weather, and to be durable enough to handle an explosion. He also carries an antenna on his back, although electrical frequencies can disrupt his signals. He's a bit of a drill-sergeant type robot, giving direct orders he expects his men to follow. It's his way or the highway! He never gives up in a battle unless absolutely necessary, and will always continue fighting, no matter the costs! All that matters is that he can taste victory at the end! He also has a disliking for renegades, and very well considers them the bane of his existence. This guy's all orders, but if you feel like disagreeing with him, it's all fine. Just expect a dozen Commando Bombs to be headed your way....

quotes.battle_start: You speak when spoken to, cadet! If that's a problem, then we settle it like men!
quotes.battle_taunt: Fire! Fire everything we have! And then fire everything we don't have!
quotes.battle_victory: Alright, you smarmy little maggot, drop down and give me 20! STAT!
quotes.battle_defeat: To think someone like {target_robot} could raze my full metal jacket... I've trained you well!

chill-man.name: Chill Man
chill-man.description2: During Dr. Wily's 11th (16th?) world domination scheme, Chill Man was one of the robots to fall to the Roboenza virus. Chill Man is a robot that was made to aid in stopping global warming and help recruit others by showing them the beauty of nature. However, while under Dr. Wily's control, his normal cooling systems were converted into weapon form, creating the Chill Spike. If the Chill Spike shot comes into direct contact with the enemy, they will be frozen in place and wide open to attacks. However, if the Chill Spike makes contact with the floor, the ice forms into the shape of 3 cone-like spikes, which can interrupt attacks and cause damage to anyone who happens to run into it. After the Roboenza incident, Chill Man was able to return to his arctic natural observation job and has found photography to be a better way of freezing a moment in time. It may seem odd for a robot to be this concerned with the environment, but Chill Man has become quite popular online for his stunning photographs of arctic life. Just try not to act too coldly to this robot; it gets lonely in a below-zero environment, you know?
chill-man.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Freeze-type abilities to only one unit
chill-man.skill_description2: The robot's expertise in cryogenic technology reduces the cost of its team's Freeze-type abilities to only one unit.

quotes.battle_start: Save the penguins! Stop global warming!
quotes.battle_taunt: No need to give me the cold shoulder, {target_robot}!
quotes.battle_victory: This will be great for my blog!
quotes.battle_defeat: Sheesh! Someone needs to take a chill pill...

sheep-man.name: Sheep Man
sheep-man.description2: A robot designed by his creator to herd sheep, Sheep Man is a bit of an unique robot, if not the most unique Robot Master out there. His signature weapon, Thunder Wool, is as every bit as unique as he is, where he creates a cloud made of pure wool to zap the opponent from above! He can also transform his material form into clouds of wool, an adjustment made by Dr. Wily when Sheep Man was infected with Roboenza. Speaking of, Dr. Wily was first unimpressed with Sheep Man, and decided not to use him in his operations, until Sheep Man showed off his electrifying qualities, and Wily gained confidence that Sheep Man would provide a fight against Mega Man. In his spare time, he volunteers at a circuit board manufacturer, testing static resistance and such. However, he easily gets bored of things and can fall asleep quite easily. He's also aware that his design is a bit ridiculous, but he'd rather take a nap than worry about such things. Speaking of sheep, since people dream of sheep jumping fence, what exactly does Sheep Man dream of? In fact, do robots even dream?
sheep-man.skill_description: The robot recovers lost health by daydreaming at the end of a turn
sheep-man.skill_description2: The robot recovers lost health by daydreaming at the end of any turn it can but loses attack in the process.

quotes.battle_start: 24, 25, 26, 2—oh, we're starting?
quotes.battle_taunt: Hang on... if androids dream of electric sheep, what do I dream of?
quotes.battle_victory: Time to say good night, you.... zzzz, good night....
quotes.battle_defeat: Yaawn... Maybe I should go back to sheep herding...

strike-man.name: Strike Man
strike-man.description2: If you ever saw the Mega City Tigers practicing for a game, you probably saw Strike Man there, pitching for them. Strike Man was created to be a batting-practice robot, but he found himself enjoying other sports, such as soccer, as well. He was especially skilled at throwing fast balls, his top speed clocking in at 121.6 mph, a whole 16.5 mph faster then the human world record equivalent. When Dr. Wily released his Roboenza on the world, Strike Man was one of the robots to fall ill, causing him to malfunction. While under Wily's control, his normal pitching abilities were updated to allow him to calculate rebound pitches. He was given the weapon Rebound Striker for fighting Mega Man. He can also launch himself into opponents, tackling them with his whole body. After the Roboenza incident, Strike Man spent several years re-perfecting his pitch. He's been put back on the Mega City Tigers, but only to pitch; whenever he goes to bat, the ball goes into orbit. If you're ever at bat with Strike Man pitching, you definitely do not want to lean into his pitches to score a free walk.

quotes.battle_start: {this_robot} enters the game, primed to take his team to the championship...
quotes.battle_taunt: Look at him, {this_robot}'s going for a classic no-hitter...
quotes.battle_victory: Three strikes, he's out of here! {this_robot} has won the game!
quotes.battle_defeat: Ow! It seems {this_robot} will be out for the rest of the season!

nitro-man.name: Nitro Man
nitro-man.description2: Chances are, even if you don’t realize it, you might recognize this Robot Master; for years, Nitro Man has served as a stunt double for some of 20XX’s biggest action stars, none more famous than his legendary motorcycle chase scene in Upgrade Impossible III. A red streak star, he was born to thrill – literally, of course, given that his chassis is outfitted with a permutable wheel set-up and makeshift engine. He even has little handlebars to steer! Eventually, at some point, Nitro Man wanted to step up his stunt game – so he had the stunt department outfit him with his Wheel Cutter ability to let him pull off some really cool wall-climbing stunts! It’s easy to gleam, but Nitro Man’s a full-blown daredevil. It doesn’t matter the feat, you can count on Nitro Man being the one to put his neck out and get that take. Granted, given he’s a robot, any death-defying stunt just lands him in the mechanic’s for a week… but it does make it tough to get insured! Notably, Nitro Man is also the acting president of a robot stunt club running sixty members strong. Just recently, they’d been campaigning for stronger union guarantees and more paid sick days after Nitro Man had been let go on Roboenza-leave. His attitude to battle is the same as his stunts; hit the throttle and don’t look back! His safety comes last! And unfortunately, yours probably does too.
nitro-man.skill_description: The robot's attack is boosted when around other Swift cores
nitro-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat is boosted two stages for each additional Swift-core robot on the field.

quotes.battle_start: Lights! Camera! Action!
quotes.battle_taunt: This is gonna be my most epic stunt yet!
quotes.battle_victory: That's a wrap! I'll be in my trailer if anyone needs me.
quotes.battle_defeat: Cut, cut, cut! Do NOT print that!

solar-man.name: Solar Man
solar-man.description2: Designed to work in a sunlight research lab, Solar Man was modified to store solar energy within his body. However, when he was inflicted with Roboenza, he used his "Solar Blaze" attack for more nefarious purposes, using his stored energy to cause major damage. He focuses more on keeping his enemies away with fiery attacks, and isn't much of a close-range fighter, as he wasn't built with any close attacks of the sort. Solar Man is a bit of a health-nut, and dislikes cloudy days. Despite being a robot, he is mindful of what he eats and prefers eating grown products. He also developed a "Solar Workout" plan, and with some refinement that he learned from his time as a robot of evil, it became a bit of a trend across the country. The workout itself is fairly simple, although intense, and borrows inspiration from the sun itself. Solar Man works out quite often, and his attacks are no solar flare, so keep an eye on this guy! Don't stare at him too long when he's pumped for battle though, or you might hurt your eyes!
solar-man.skill_description: Reduces the cost of its team's Flame-type abilities to only one unit
solar-man.skill_description2: The robot's renewable solar energy reduces the cost of its team's Flame-type abilities to only one unit.

quotes.battle_start: Alright, alright... let's start with our warm-ups!
quotes.battle_taunt: And one, and two, and one, and two...
quotes.battle_victory: Whew! What a workout! I'm burning with a youthful fire!
quotes.battle_defeat: No fair, it was cloudy out! I should have listened to Weather Man...

block-man.name: Block Man
block-man.description2: Due to Dr. Light's lengthy and glowing history in the area of construction-oriented robots, Block Man was a robot specially contracted by Nakaume Heavy Machinery to assist in their urban development programs, specifically in circumventing the arduous work of wall architecture. This intent is nowhere else more highlighted than in Block Man's Block Dropper, which generates weighty stone blocks to be plunged straight down from the air. Despite it seeming amateurish and simplistic in motion, this technique does genuinely require quite a bit of care and precision to avoid any accidental aching head injuries. And on that front, Block Man is, well... he's not spotless. Nevertheless, despite his short and stout physique, Block Man's filled to the brim with energy, even if this is primarily to serve his own ambition. See, it's his dream to one day create a vast system of structures inspired by temples and pyramids of old, preferably with his face adorned somewhere to let people know the craftsman. In that sense, he's admittedly rather vain and thick as a brick, and even with his cement attire, insults can crumble his temperament with ease. Still, he's close friends with fellow Nakaume robot Impact Man, and really, there's not a work of architecture out there that can weather the elements better than a strong friendship! Well, not literally that is; then Block Man's handiwork prevails.

quotes.battle_start: Solid job gettin' here; shame I've gotta knock your block off now!
quotes.battle_taunt: Don't you mock me... I'm not just another brick in the wall!
quotes.battle_victory: .. Say, {target_robot}, you build a temple with my face on it and I'll forget this ever happened!
quotes.battle_defeat: Hrrgh, it's just so mortifying... Nobody blocks Block Man!

fuse-man.name: Fuse Man
fuse-man.description2: Manufactured by O.D.A Electronics as their equivalent to Elec Man, Fuse Man works overseeing and managing the electrical equipment at a power plant much like his Light counterpart. Don't let that fool you; it'd be erroneous to classify him as a mere Elec Man rip-off, as while Elec Man actively manipulates the flow of electricity, Fuse Man travels alongside it to efficiently fine tune any power transformers. As one may imagine, this makes Fuse Man unbelievably fast, rivaling the speed of a lightning bolt as his body condenses beyond mere matter to become pure energy! And, if his speed doesn't do the trick, his "Scramble Thunder" releases mild bolts of electricity to cover even further ground. While this method is certainly admirable, it is not without its flaws; channeling currents excessively or improperly will cause him to short circuit, and thus his fuses will preemptively blow to avoid a potential critical overload. As such, Fuse Man can never afford to be capricious, as his sense of responsibility will dictate either a city's pleasantly leisure or its catastrophic blackout. Of course, being on edge 24/7 is exceedingly stressful even for tireless robots, so he comes up with silly puns to discharge any anxiety. Yet, he's always fully charged mentally after he's gotten to tend to his dear pet rabbit, "Watt." You'd think that something like an electrical eel would fit his tastes more thematically, but chances are his rabbit probably just makes him feel more comfortable about his over-the-top headgear....
fuse-man.skill_description: Boosts the robot's speed on Electric-type fields
fuse-man.skill_description2: The robot's speed stat is boosted by one stage at the end of each turn when the Electric-type field multiplier is high.

quotes.battle_start: I can't just refuse a good challenge... Prepare to die-ode!
quotes.battle_taunt: Let's amp this up! High voltage!
quotes.battle_victory: When you're as lightning-efficient as me, you never get to have a day off...
quotes.battle_defeat: M-my electrons are s-scrambled... Short circuit!!!

blast-man.name: Blast Man
blast-man.description2: For most bomb-inclined robots, explosions are a method of strength, terror, exhilaration, or spectacle, but to Blast Man, explosions are his paintbrush and he is its artist. Manufactured by the B.B Bomb Company not for excavation but as a pyrotechnician, Blast Man provides practical effects from the smallest of bangs to cataclysmic bangs for some of the most established movie sets and theme parks in the world. His understanding of the importance of timing when it comes to explosions is also profound, and this makes him a whiz with his signature Chain Blast ability, a series of timed sticky bombs that, when detonated together, adds a wholly-inspired flourish of visual wonder! Any who know him would say that Blast Man may be volatile, unstable, and too easily excited, and while they’re completely right about that, underneath the crazy hair and cobalt blue armor is the heart of an explosion artist. Blast Man has such a blazing passion for incendiary bursts that he even pens a serial column in his favorite magazine, Boom Monthly. And more than anything, Blast Man seeks to fulfill his life-long aspiration of creating ‘Blast Man Adventure’, an awe-inspiring, death-defying thrill-ride that’ll render even the hardiest of thrill-seekers blown away! Of course, despite being an artist, Blast Man’s chaotic gracefulness is also a major asset in the battlefield, and can only be aptly described as…. Well, to quote Blast Man’s own writing, “freakin’ awesome. Ka-boom. Ka-blam. Pow.”
blast-man.skill_description: Increases the Explode-type field multiplier on battle start
blast-man.skill_description2: The robot increases the Explode-type field multiplier upon entering battle in preparation for a dynamite performance.

quotes.battle_start: The countdown begins, {target_robot}! Retaliate or detonate!
quotes.battle_taunt: Hey, what's wrong? C'mon, don't be a dud, bud!
quotes.battle_victory: Explosions... what a work of art, right? RIGHT?!
quotes.battle_defeat: My last blast.... THAT WAS FREAKIN' AWESOME!

acid-man.name: Acid Man
acid-man.description2: A chemical plant may sound like an unfitting home for anyone with the smallest shred of sense, but for Acid Man, it's practically paradise. Manufactured by the Mecha-Chucets Institute of Robology, Acid Man's so comfortable with acerbic properties that he has tubes upon tubes of who-knows-whats constantly coursing through his body like a bloodstream.   And for practicality in the plant, Acid Man's buster is specially designed to easily expel those chemicals -- though this gives him an obvious edge in combat as well. Not only can he fire biting globs in rapid succession, but he has such high chemical mastery that he can enclose himself in a barrier of corrosive acid that'll keep even the most courageous of robots at bay. Of course, you couldn't do the mad chemical mixer any justice without mentioning his impeccable swimming prowess. As a byproduct of a cutting-edge hydrodynamic design, Acid Man will gladly take a graceful dive into the plant's chemical tanks and swim worry-free as he ensures that the tanks' measurements stay true to his high standards. This habit has led the plant's human workers to give him the sobriquet of "the Acid Merman", a nickname Acid Man so vehemently detests. And on the topic of detest, the only thing Acid Man detests more is sloppy work; he's well-known for being an utter perfectionist in the workplace, one that doesn't shy away from throwing tantrums when chemicals aren't measured out to his exact expectations. This may give one the impression that Acid Man is only a mad scientist gone too far, but is it really so 'mad' to have a passion that burns with such bright joy that you're literally named after what you love?... If it's highly corrosive acid, then yes, probably.

quotes.battle_start: Come to ruin my chemical paradise, hmm? It's high-time for an experiment!
quotes.battle_taunt: You're ruining everything... I swear I'll melt you to the last bolt!
quotes.battle_victory: These results confirm my theory... Acid fixes everything, eheh!
quotes.battle_defeat: Nyeagh... Chemistry, my love... I've failed you!

tundra-man.name: Tundra Man
tundra-man.description2: Out in the most desolate and algid areas of the arctic, a hulking surveillance robot catches a glance of the 20XX World Ice Skating Championship on the television. Inspired by the humans who could make the ice their dance floor, this robot challenged the notions of their creation and began to make modifications to become gracile and graceful, transforming into the Robot Master we now know as Tundra Man. Though designed by Dr. Cossack to monitor drastic environmental changes and develop land in the coldest climates of Earth, Tundra Man’s love of ice skating quickly took over and encouraged him to put on the skates, making him far faster than Cossack had ever originally intended! Tundra Man’s so fast, in fact, that his triple axel is capable of producing a numbing funnel of subzero winds! But, combat is never his first priority; skating is his raison d'être, and if he happens to bump into anyone while doing so, so be it. He’s flashy, dramatic, but most of all!.... He’s really rather lonely. With an audience of mainly huskies, polar bears, and seals, Tundra Man yearns for the day for when he can display his dazzling  footwork to the same grand stage that had inspired him so many years ago! For now, styling on his opponents during combat will have to do.

quotes.battle_start: It's showtime! Cue the music, dim the lights... And let me dance!
quotes.battle_taunt: Take my spotlight, ehh? BITTER! HEARTLESS! Yet... DRAMATIC!
quotes.battle_victory: I am but a rose, frozen in ice... You? You're just yellow snow!
quotes.battle_defeat: Shattered are my dreams... but it made for a wondrous grand finale!

torch-man.name: Torch Man
torch-man.description2: Within the murky expanse of the wilds of nature, a single beacon lights the way to safety… Torch Man! Working as an outdoors advisor as a product of Tsubakuro Precision Machining, Torch Man delights in teaching others on how only they can prevent forest fires. Though one would suspect Torch Man and his safety hazard shoulders would be ill-fitting in a densely shrubbed area, he actually undergoes a strict training regiment to keep his heat under self-control; yet in moments where he becomes especially emblazoned, he can unleash spiraling infernos that soar and crash into the ground below! While impressive, it has little use in camping circumstances, so Torch Man dedicates himself to practicing martial arts daily to keep the fire burning within him tempered. Aside from being adept in the Shotokan and Aikido styles, Torch Man also started his own form of martial arts, ‘Torch-jutsu’, centered around strong self-discipline and jumping kicks. But despite his regiments, he can’t help but afford to lapse when he emotionally flares up, like the time he crisped the camp dinner during a particularly invigorating turkey roast. As such, Torch Man still walks the long and harrowing road of self-improvement, never stopping, never faltering, until the day he can keep his searing spirit in check. His latest step in training, for example, was to stand under the calming pressure of a raging waterfall. The subsequent repairs took three months….

quotes.battle_start: Here comes a new challenger... Let's fight!
quotes.battle_taunt: Fall to the fist of flame! TORCH-JUTSU!
quotes.battle_victory: You must defeat my flaming fist to stand a chance.
quotes.battle_defeat: If I'm to ever master these flames, my path lies in more training.

impact-man.name: Impact Man
impact-man.description2: A hard-working Robot Master who always pushes through, it’s Impact Man!... Or perhaps, it may be more appropriate to say “Impact Men”? Though he certainly gives off the appearance of a sturdy construction robot, Impact Man is actually comprised of three separate pile driver robots, collectively known as the Impact Brothers. The separating is certainly helpful when it comes to cover the most ground in piling endeavors, but for the most part, it’s only when the three brothers work together in an unified effort that they can make great strides in their work. And great strides do they make; beyond his sturdy frame, one may notice Impact Man’s signature piling equipment functioning as his ligaments, and utilizing his strong acceleration can he make a great impact on dense foundation walls. And due to his segmented design, he can handily morph his form to whatever the situation requires! As Impact Man, he is nothing short of diligent, a worker who never hesitates to completing the task in record time. As individual siblings however, the personalities… begin to vary: Kui-ichiro, the oldest, takes lead control, but the efficient youngest sibling, Kui-saburo, often substitutes in. On the other hand, the middle sibling, Kui-jiro, is awfully disorderly and thus can’t be trusted to take the reins. But though the brothers may quarrel from time to time, ultimately they’ll always defend each other from any slight and push through when the job’s on the line! Surely an inspiring sentiment to his bystanders, but absolutely frightening to his enemies!

quotes.battle_start: The three Impact brothers combined together... We are Impact Man!
quotes.battle_taunt: Brothers, are you thinking what I'm thinking? Impale! Impair! Implode!
quotes.battle_victory: Once we work as one and just push through, nothing can stop us!
quotes.battle_defeat: Kui-jiro... from now on, you're not allowed to take the reins.

bounce-man.name: Bounce Man
bounce-man.description2: To live life as vicariously as a ball bouncing happily upon its own momentum must be an utterly carefree lifestyle, wouldn’t it? Now with Bounce Man as evidence, the answer to that question is a resounding ‘yes!’ Originally developed by Joint R&D to work as a recyclable crash test robot, his phenomenal elasticity and resilience bestowed him a position at ‘Boing Boing Park’, an indoor athletics facility meant to teach children the importance of exercise. Given the proper momentum, Bounce Man with his hefty stature can bounce and fling around rooms like a rubber ball that just won’t stop, making him an unintentional nuisance to the people around him! His elastic jab makes for a heck of a punch, and he can even toss out more bouncy balls to crowd out the room with. All this would make Bounce Man one of the toughest Robot Masters out there, but due to his childlike demeanor, combat’s just one big silly game to him! Innocence and optimism abound emanate from his joyous disposition, and kids go crazy for his funny looks and big, round body. He’s also surprisingly popular among middle-aged women due to his ‘Hopxercise” program -- it’s like boxing, but on trampolines. All in all, Bounce Man’s jocular reputation have made him and Boing Boing Park a household name for all who enjoy the act of bouncing. Thus, it is no wonder to see how Bounce Man can be so carefree and riddled with positive energy! Actually, there is one thing that gets him down in the dumps… the stairs!
bounce-man.skill_description: The robot uses its massive body to protect benched allies
bounce-man.skill_description2: The robot uses its massive body to protect benched allies from being targeted by the opponent's abilities.

quotes.battle_start: Boy oh boy, a new special playmate! Wanna bounce?
quotes.battle_taunt: Oops, Bounce Man always bounces back! Bounce me again, again!
quotes.battle_victory: Hehe, you were so, so fun! Catch you on the rebound!
quotes.battle_defeat: Aww, playtime's over...? I guess that's the way the ball bounces...

quotes.battle_start: Yikes!  You weren't supposed to find me...
quotes.battle_taunt: Might as well stick around now that you're here!
quotes.battle_victory: Looks like you got yourself into a sticky situation!
quotes.battle_defeat: It's too late, we're "Bonded for Life" now...

quotes.battle_start: Here I come! Feeding frenzy!
quotes.battle_taunt: Nothing will save you from these jaws of death!
quotes.battle_victory: You're nothing more than small fry.
quotes.battle_defeat: I bit off more than I could chew...

blossom-woman.name: Blossom Woman
blossom-woman.description2: Blossom Woman is based on an early design by Dr. Wily, and may have made it to production had Wily not abducted Plant Man instead several months later. Blossom Woman would have served a similar purpose to Plant Man, but would have also been able to communicate with both plant and insect life. This concept was later revisited by Dr. Light in his design for a "Honey Woman," which eventually became Hornet Man. Naturally, Blossom Woman's design seems to be based off both a flower and possibly a praying mantis or similar insect.

quotes.battle_start: This rose has finally bloomed!
quotes.battle_taunt: Are you distracted by my amazing beauty?
quotes.battle_victory: Our fight was beautiful, but not as beautiful as me!
quotes.battle_defeat: How dare you! Do you know how long it took me to get ready?!

quotes.battle_start: Will I get to you first, or the heat?!
quotes.battle_taunt: You can't survive much longer, can you?
quotes.battle_victory: The spirit of the West powers me!
quotes.battle_defeat: Maybe I've been out too long in the desert to fight.

quotes.battle_start: Don't expect any treats tonight....only tricks!
quotes.battle_taunt: Boo! Wahaha! Does the dark scare you?!
quotes.battle_victory: Waha! Tonight, make sure to check under your bed for me, the Boogeyman!
quotes.battle_defeat: I always did hate taking a Fall! Wahaha-Ow!

quotes.battle_start: Come on, hit me with your best shot!
quotes.battle_taunt: Is that really all you got?
quotes.battle_victory: You know what they say, a good defense is a good offense!
quotes.battle_defeat: Incredible! You managed to break my defense!

quotes.battle_start: Do you expect to actually beat me with those weapons?
quotes.battle_taunt: My lasers are really state of the art, aren't they?
quotes.battle_victory: Of course I won, my lasers can penetrate anything!
quotes.battle_defeat: I lost? No way, my lasers are.. oh, forget it!

quotes.battle_start: Yo, {target_robot}! Can I interest you in some parts?
quotes.battle_taunt: I want fan letters too....
quotes.battle_victory: I'm the best!
quotes.battle_defeat: Hey! Wait a darn minute! You're not supposed to be on this page, player!
